translated: In Sanskrit:

original: aa po ha n'a ma pra ka ra na /
analyzed: aa po ha n'a ma pra ka ra na /
translated: Apoha-prakarana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa //
translated: The Chapter on Exclusion

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to youthful Manjushri.

original: rtog bcas blo yi gang gi rang bzhin gzhan gyis dpen par rab bstan pa //
analyzed: rtog bcas blo yi gang gi rang bzhin gzhan gyis dpen par rab bstan pa //
translated: The nature of that which is taught by the conceptual mind as separate from others

original: blo min phyi min de nyid ma yin sgro btags gang nyid brjod pa yis//
analyzed: blo min phyi min de nyid ma yin sgro btags gang nyid brjod pa yis//
translated: Is not the mind, not the later, not reality, and not what is expressed by superimposition.

original: 'gro la de nyid gsungs pa rnam rgyal mnga' ba ma lus skyon bral ba //
analyzed: 'gro la de nyid gsungs pa rnam rgyal mnga' ba ma lus skyon bral ba //
translated: The one who taught reality to beings, the all-victorious one, free from all faults,

original: gsung mdzad gang yin de la mgos phyag 'tshal nas sel ba de 'dir bshad //
analyzed: gsung mdzad gang yin de la mgos phyag 'tshal nas sel ba de 'dir bshad //
translated: To that one, I bow my head and explain exclusion here.

original: 'di la mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu skyed par rung ba'i dngos po rtogs par bya ba'i phyir brda rab tu sbyar ba'i sgra dag gis ji lta ji lta bu'i dngos po rtogs par byas nas de dag la tha snyad byed pa po don du gnyer bar 'jug🔽par byed do //
analyzed: 'di la mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu skyed par rung ba'i dngos po rtogs par bya ba'i phyir brda rab tu sbyar ba'i sgra dag gis ji lta ji lta bu'i dngos po rtogs par byas nas de dag la tha snyad byed pa po don du gnyer bar 'jug🔽par byed do //
translated: In this [system], in order to understand the entity that is suitable to produce the desired result, the words that apply the convention, having understood the entity in such and such a way, the one who makes the conventional designation engages in pursuing the meaning.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag yul med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag yul med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not non-existent objects.

original: gsal ba ni yod kyang brjod par bya ba'i dngos po yin pa bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba ni yod kyang brjod par bya ba'i dngos po yin pa bzlog pa yin no //
translated: Even though the manifestation exists, the fact that it is an object of expression is refuted.

original: rnam pa dngos por yod pa yang thag bsrings so //
analyzed: rnam pa dngos por yod pa yang thag bsrings so //
translated: The existence of the manifestation as an entity is also refuted.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam pa dang ldan pa'i gsal ba yang yod pa ma yin zhing de'i 'brel pa yang med do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam pa dang ldan pa'i gsal ba yang yod pa ma yin zhing de'i 'brel pa yang med do //
translated: Therefore, the manifestation that possesses aspects does not exist, nor does its connection.

original: de la 'di dag gi don du 'dod pa gang zhe na smras pa /🔽rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi yul gang yin pa de sgra'i don yin no //
analyzed: de la 'di dag gi don du 'dod pa gang zhe na smras pa / rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi yul gang yin pa de sgra'i don yin no //
translated: What is it that is accepted as the meaning of those?🔽The object of conceptualization is the meaning of the word.

original: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba nyid brjod pa'i don du sgra sbyor la //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba nyid brjod pa'i don du sgra sbyor la //
translated: The word is applied to the appearance in conceptualization as the meaning of expression.

original: @236b de las kyang brjod par bya ba la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ste /
analyzed: @236b de las kyang brjod par bya ba la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ste /
translated: And from that, the conceptualization that observes the object of expression arises.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu dang nye bar len pa gnyis kyis nye bar bzung ba ni sgra'i don yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu dang nye bar len pa gnyis kyis nye bar bzung ba ni sgra'i don yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the word is that which is grasped by both the effect and the appropriator.

original: de la spyi ni med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la spyi ni med pa nyid do //
translated: In that regard, the universal does not exist.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni yod kyang rnam par rtog pa'i snang bas rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni yod kyang rnam par rtog pa'i snang bas rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: Although the intrinsic identity of things does exist, it is not the object of conceptual cognition, because it does not follow the occurrence and cessation of things as they appear.

original: dngos po tha dad pa ni snang bas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed na shes pa'i yul yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa ni snang bas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed na shes pa'i yul yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: If things were different, they would be the objects of cognition, because they would follow the occurrence and cessation of appearances, but not otherwise.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa ni dngos po'i yul can ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa ni dngos po'i yul can ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, conceptual cognition does not have real things as its objects.

original: dngos po ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor are things indeterminate,

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa ni phyi rol gyi me la sogs pa dngos po nges par skye ba dang 'gag par nyams su myong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa ni phyi rol gyi me la sogs pa dngos po nges par skye ba dang 'gag par nyams su myong ngo //
translated: because conceptual cognition arises and ceases in dependence on real things, such as external fire, etc., which are determinate.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mngon sum gyi 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa ni snang ba'i dbang gis yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mngon sum gyi 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa ni snang ba'i dbang gis yin la /
translated: Therefore, the apprehension and nonapprehension of direct perception is due to the presence or absence of appearances,

original: rnam par rtog pa ni nges pa'i dbang gis yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni nges pa'i dbang gis yin no //
translated: but conceptual cognition is due to determination.

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed par snang gi cung zad kyang nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed par snang gi cung zad kyang nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because perception appears to conform to the presence or absence of the intrinsic identity, but it does not ascertain anything at all.

original: des na de'i snang ba'i dbang gis 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i snang ba'i dbang gis 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the presence or absence of apprehension is due to the power of its appearance.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gzung ba'i rnam pa ni me la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ma yin gyi me la sogs pa nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gzung ba'i rnam pa ni me la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ma yin gyi me la sogs pa nges pa yin no //
translated: The aspect of the apprehended object of conceptual cognition does not conform to the presence or absence of fire, etc., but it is ascertained as fire, etc.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni nges pa'i dbang kho nas 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa yin gyi gzung ba snang ba'i stobs kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni nges pa'i dbang kho nas 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa yin gyi gzung ba snang ba'i stobs kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the presence or absence of apprehension is due to the power of ascertainment alone, not due to the power of the appearance of the apprehended object.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi 'dzin pa'i byed pa ni nges pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi 'dzin pa'i byed pa ni nges pa nyid yin la /
translated: If the function of apprehending of conceptual cognitions is ascertainment,

original: rnam par rtog pa rang gi mtshan nyid nges par byed pa yang de lta yin pa de lta na 'o na ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis nges par byas pa'i gzung ba yin pa de lta na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rang gi mtshan nyid nges par byed pa yang de lta yin pa de lta na 'o na ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis nges par byas pa'i gzung ba yin pa de lta na /
translated: If that is so, then the intrinsic identity is the apprehended object ascertained by conceptual cognition. In that case,

original: ci'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dngos po med par brtags pa'i yul can du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dngos po med par brtags pa'i yul can du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: why is the object of conceptual cognition imagined to be a non-existent entity?

original: 'di la gang gi snang bas rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed pa'i dngos po tha dad pa de ni de'i yul yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di la gang gi snang bas rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed pa'i dngos po tha dad pa de ni de'i yul yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained that the object is that entity whose presence or absence is in accordance with the appearance of that cognition.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa ni phyi rol yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su mi byed de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa ni phyi rol yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su mi byed de /
translated: The aspect of conceptual cognition does not conform to the existence or non-existence of external objects.

original: des na yul ma yin no //
analyzed: des na yul ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the object.

original: ci ste 'dir pha rol gyi bsam pa snang ba'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa'i yul du 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ci ste 'dir pha rol gyi bsam pa snang ba'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa'i yul du 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: If you say that the intrinsic identity is not the object of conceptual cognition because it appears as the object of another cognition,

original: 'on kyang nges par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang nges par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but it is the object because it is ascertained,

original: ji ltar rnam par @237a * //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par @237a * //
translated: how is it ascertained?

original: rtog pa rnams kyis 'dzin par byed pa nyid mngon sum ltar gzung ba'i rnam pa 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rtog pa rnams kyis 'dzin par byed pa nyid mngon sum ltar gzung ba'i rnam pa 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Conceptual consciousnesses apprehend their objects by means of the aspect of the object that is apprehended, not by means of the object’s own nature.🔽However, they ascertain their objects.

original: 'on kyang nges par byed pa yin pa de bzhin du 'di'i gzung ba dang snang ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang nges par byed pa yin pa de bzhin du 'di'i gzung ba dang snang ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, the object of conceptual consciousnesses is not the object that appears to them,

original: 'on kyang nges par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang nges par bya ba yin no //
translated: but rather the object that is ascertained by them.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang nges pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang nges pa yin te /
translated: The object’s own nature is also ascertained.

original: nges na de gzung ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin la /
analyzed: nges na de gzung ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin la /
translated: If it is ascertained, it is apprehended.

original: 'dir bshad pa gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin yang de nges pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ste /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin yang de nges pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ste /
translated: Here, the explanation is this: Although the object’s own nature does not exist, a conceptual consciousness that ascertains it arises.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore conceptual consciousnesses do not ascertain the object’s own nature.

original: 'o na rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa yin na de rnam par rtog pas 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa yin na de rnam par rtog pas 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the object’s own nature exists, it would be apprehended by conceptual consciousness.

original: de ltar ni mi nus te /
analyzed: de ltar ni mi nus te /
translated: But that is not possible.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis nges pa'i don ni sgra dang 'dres pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis nges pa'i don ni sgra dang 'dres pa yin la /
translated: The meaning ascertained by conceptual consciousnesses is mixed with words.

original: sgra dang 'dres pa de yang gang brda'i dus su sgra dang 'dres par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: sgra dang 'dres pa de yang gang brda'i dus su sgra dang 'dres par mthong ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the connection with the word is seen at the time of the convention.

original: 'brel bar mthong ba yang gang zhig sgra brjod pa las snang ba'i don de nyid yin na dngos po'i rang bzhin ni sgra'i bya ba'i dus na mi snang ste /
analyzed: 'brel bar mthong ba yang gang zhig sgra brjod pa las snang ba'i don de nyid yin na dngos po'i rang bzhin ni sgra'i bya ba'i dus na mi snang ste /
translated: And the connection is seen in that the object that appears from the utterance of the word is the very same thing. But the nature of the thing does not appear at the time of the activity of the word.

original: de'i phyir de ni yod pa ma yin yang rnam par rtog pas nges pa ma yin no zhes bya bar gdon mi za'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni yod pa ma yin yang rnam par rtog pas nges pa ma yin no zhes bya bar gdon mi za'o //
translated: Therefore, it is undoubtedly the case that although it does not exist, it is not ascertained by the conceptual consciousness.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa rnams dngos po nges pa'i bdag nyid du legs par rtogs kyang rang gi mtshan nyid nges pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni shin tu ngo mtshar che ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa rnams dngos po nges pa'i bdag nyid du legs par rtogs kyang rang gi mtshan nyid nges pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni shin tu ngo mtshar che ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is well understood that conceptual consciousnesses have the nature of ascertaining things, then why is it said that they do not ascertain their own characteristics?

original: 'di la ngo mtshar cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: 'di la ngo mtshar cung zad kyang med de /
translated: This is a very great wonder.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnams ni sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin rang gi mtshan nyid du med pa nyid zhen par skyes pa na dngos po nges pa nyid du skyes pa rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnams ni sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin rang gi mtshan nyid du med pa nyid zhen par skyes pa na dngos po nges pa nyid du skyes pa rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: When conceptual thoughts arise, they are conceptual thoughts that arise in regard to the intrinsic identity of superimpositions that do not exist.

original: de dag dngos po yod pa nyid nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag dngos po yod pa nyid nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not ascertain the existence of things.

original: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid du nges pa med pa nyid nye bar ston pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni dngos po med pa nges pa yin gyi dngos po nges pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di la mi 'thad pa cung zad kyang med do
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid du nges pa med pa nyid nye bar ston pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni dngos po med pa nges pa yin gyi dngos po nges pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di la mi 'thad pa cung zad kyang med do
translated: Therefore, conceptual thoughts that reveal the non-ascertainment of intrinsic identity ascertain the non-existence of things, but they do not ascertain things. There is not the slightest incoherence in this.

original: // gal te gzung ba'i rnam pa rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi yul ma yin nam des na ci'i phyir sgro btags pa 'dzin par brjod ce na /
analyzed: // gal te gzung ba'i rnam pa rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi yul ma yin nam des na ci'i phyir sgro btags pa 'dzin par brjod ce na /
translated: If the aspects of apprehended objects are not the objects of conceptual thoughts, why is it said that they apprehend superimpositions?

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa ni rang rig pa'i yul yin gyi rnam par rtog par rtog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa ni rang rig pa'i yul yin gyi rnam par rtog par rtog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The aspects of apprehended objects are the objects of autocognition, but they are not conceptual thoughts.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig nges par byas pa de rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig nges par byas pa de rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin no //
translated: Thus, that which is ascertained is the object of conceptualization.

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa ni nges pa ma yin na de ji ltar rnam par @237b rtog pa'i yul du 'gyur /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa ni nges pa ma yin na de ji ltar rnam par @237b rtog pa'i yul du 'gyur /
translated: But the form of the object of apprehension is not ascertained, so how can it be the object of conceptualization?

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa sgra dang 'dres pa'i don nges par byed kyang rang gi bdag nyid la rnam par mi rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa sgra dang 'dres pa'i don nges par byed kyang rang gi bdag nyid la rnam par mi rtog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though the meaning of a word is ascertained as mixed with the word, it is not conceptual with regard to itself.

original: gang gi phyir bdag nyid ni ma nges pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag nyid ni ma nges pa yin la /
translated: Because the form of the object of apprehension is not ascertained,

original: ma nges pa yang rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: ma nges pa yang rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: and that which is not ascertained is not the object of conceptualization.

original: de ltar yang /🔽nges pa rnams kyi ma nges pa //
analyzed: de ltar yang / nges pa rnams kyi ma nges pa //
translated: Thus it is said:🔽How can that which is not ascertained

original: de ni ji ltar de dag yul //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar de dag yul // zhes bshad do //
translated: for those who are certain be their object?

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du lhag par zhen pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du lhag par zhen pa ma yin nam /
translated: If conceptualization is not the superimposition of meaning on a meaningless appearance of itself,

original: de'i phyir de ni de'i yul yin no zhe na /🔽ci lhag par zhen pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni de'i yul yin no zhe na / ci lhag par zhen pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin //
translated: then how can it be the object of that?🔽What is this so-called superimposition?

original: ci 'dzin pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci 'dzin pa yin nam /
translated: Is it apprehension?

original: 'on te byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te byed pa yin nam /
translated: Or is it activity?

original: de ste sbyor ba yin nam /
analyzed: de ste sbyor ba yin nam /
translated: Is it a connection?

original: ci ste sgro 'dogs pa yin /
analyzed: ci ste sgro 'dogs pa yin /
translated: Or is it superimposition?

original: de la rnam par rtog pa rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: In that case, how could a conception be the apprehension of a meaning that is a meaningless appearance?

original: byed par yang ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byed par yang ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: And how could it be a connection?

original: gzhan ni gzhan gyi rang bzhin du bya bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan gyi rang bzhin du bya bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: For one thing cannot be connected to the nature of another.

original: ma bzung ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang bdag nyid sbyor par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: ma bzung ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang bdag nyid sbyor par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: And how could it be a connection of a non-apprehended intrinsic identity to itself?

original: sgro 'dogs pa yang nyams su myong ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin na /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa yang nyams su myong ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin na /
translated: Moreover, if superimposition is preceded by experience,

original: rnam par rtog pa ni sngar rang gi snang ba myong nas phyis sgro 'dogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni sngar rang gi snang ba myong nas phyis sgro 'dogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: then it is not the case that a conception superimposes something later after first experiencing its own appearance.

original: dngos po skad cig gnyis su sdod pa ni med na de ji ltar sngar nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid phyis don gzhan la sgro 'dogs par byed //
analyzed: dngos po skad cig gnyis su sdod pa ni med na de ji ltar sngar nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid phyis don gzhan la sgro 'dogs par byed //
translated: If an entity does not endure for a second moment, how could it later superimpose itself on another object?

original: ci ste rang gi rang bzhin nyams su myong ba dang / don du sgro 'dogs pa dang dus mnyam pa yin na de ltar na ni 'o na snang ba nyams su myong ba dang dus mnyam du sgro btags pa snang ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pas dngos po med pa rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin no zhes gnas pa
analyzed: ci ste rang gi rang bzhin nyams su myong ba dang / don du sgro 'dogs pa dang dus mnyam pa yin na de ltar na ni 'o na snang ba nyams su myong ba dang dus mnyam du sgro btags pa snang ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pas dngos po med pa rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin no zhes gnas pa
translated: But if the experience of its intrinsic reality is simultaneous with the superimposition of an object, then the superimposition of an object is not the intrinsic reality of an appearance. Therefore, the object of conceptualization is a non-existent thing.

original: de yang 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa yin no //
translated: This is the position of the opponent.

original: 'o na rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du zhen nas 'jug pa yin no zhes bshad pa 'di'i don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du zhen nas 'jug pa yin no zhes bshad pa 'di'i don gang yin zhe na /
translated: But if you accept this, then what is the meaning of the statement, “One engages by conceiving a non-existent object as an object in one’s own appearance”?

original: sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin de la gzung ba'i rnam pa bye brag tu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin no //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin de la gzung ba'i rnam pa bye brag tu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin no //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: The intrinsic reality of a superimposition is not a separate object that is apprehended.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa de nyid kyis sgro btags kyi rang bzhin shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par nges pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa de nyid kyis sgro btags kyi rang bzhin shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par nges pa ma yin la /
translated: In this way, the intrinsic reality of a superimposition is not ascertained by the cognition of that conceptualization itself.

original: rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it ascertained by another conceptualization.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni sgro btags kyi don bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni sgro btags kyi don bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi ma yin zhing /
translated: The aspect of the apprehender is not the basis of the self-grasping of the superimposed object.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa @238a * //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa @238a * //
translated: It is not the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: de las gzhan du bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi nyid dang bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du de la rig pa yin no //🔽de la sgro btags kyi rang bzhin las rnam par ma phyed pas rnam par rtog pa ni gzung ba'i rnam pa don med pa la don du lhag par zhen to zhes brjod kyi rnam par rtog pa bdag nyid kyi gzung ba'i rnam pa phyi rol gyi me yin
analyzed: de las gzhan du bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi nyid dang bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du de la rig pa yin no // de la sgro btags kyi rang bzhin las rnam par ma phyed pas rnam par rtog pa ni gzung ba'i rnam pa don med pa la don du lhag par zhen to zhes brjod kyi rnam par rtog pa bdag nyid kyi gzung ba'i rnam pa phyi rol gyi me yin
translated: It is the basis of self-grasping in a way that is different from that, and it is the awareness of that as having the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: par lhag par zhen nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: par lhag par zhen nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is said that conceptualization, not distinguishing the superimposed nature from it, adheres to the unreal aspect of the apprehended as real, but it is not able to adhere to the aspect of the apprehended as the external object itself.

original: de bzhin du gang yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang yang /
translated: And also:

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan ni //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan ni //
translated: The conceptual image

original: de yi mthar thug rnams la 'brel //
analyzed: de yi mthar thug rnams la 'brel //
translated: is related to its final end.

original: sgra yi shes la tha dad ltar //
analyzed: sgra yi shes la tha dad ltar //
translated: Like the difference in the cognition of sound,

original: don gyi gzugs brnyan snang gyur pa //
analyzed: don gyi gzugs brnyan snang gyur pa //
translated: The image of the object appears,

original: de yang don gyi bdag nyid min //
analyzed: de yang don gyi bdag nyid min //
translated: but it is not of the nature of the object.

original: de 'khrul bag chags rang bzhin can //
analyzed: de 'khrul bag chags rang bzhin can //
translated: It is a habitual propensity for error.🔽

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa gang yin pa thams cad kyang rnam pa dang sgro btags pa tha dad du lhag par zhen pa med pa'i phyir gcig nyid kyi tha snyad du khas blangs nas bshad par lta'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa gang yin pa thams cad kyang rnam pa dang sgro btags pa tha dad du lhag par zhen pa med pa'i phyir gcig nyid kyi tha snyad du khas blangs nas bshad par lta'o //
translated: and all the other explanations that have been given, such as “the nature of a latent error,” are to be understood as explanations that are accepted as being the same, because there is no separate reification of the aspect and the superimposition.

original: yang na ni rnam pa 'di lta bu'i phyogs su sgro btags nyid la gzugs brnyan du brjod pa yin gyi gzung ba'i rnam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na ni rnam pa 'di lta bu'i phyogs su sgro btags nyid la gzugs brnyan du brjod pa yin gyi gzung ba'i rnam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Or else, the term “reflection” is used in the sense of a superimposition that has the following aspect: it is not the aspect of the object that is apprehended.

original: gang gi phyir sgro btags pa la ni phyi rol du nges par byas pa yin pa'i phyir phyi rol 'dra ba phyi rol gyi gzugs brnyan zhes brjod par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgro btags pa la ni phyi rol du nges par byas pa yin pa'i phyir phyi rol 'dra ba phyi rol gyi gzugs brnyan zhes brjod par nus pa yin no //
translated: For, in the case of a superimposition, it is possible to say that it is “like an external object” and “a reflection of an external object,” because it is determined to be external.

original: gang zhig rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis nges pa'i don de yang gang yin /
analyzed: gang zhig rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis nges pa'i don de yang gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of “determinate” in the phrase “determinate cognition”?

original: ci shes pa'i bdag nyid yin nam /
analyzed: ci shes pa'i bdag nyid yin nam /
translated: Is it the nature of consciousness?

original: 'on te gzhan yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan yin zhe na /
translated: Or is it something else?

original: cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: We say that it is neither.

original: ma nges pa ni nyams su myong bas grub la /
analyzed: ma nges pa ni nyams su myong bas grub la /
translated: The non-ascertainment is established by experience.

original: shes pa nyid ni sreg pa'i bsgrub bya sgrub pa'i me ma yin zhing de'i tshe phyi rol 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te /🔽ji ltar nges pa ni de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: shes pa nyid ni sreg pa'i bsgrub bya sgrub pa'i me ma yin zhing de'i tshe phyi rol 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te / ji ltar nges pa ni de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Consciousness itself is not the fire that establishes the object of burning, and at that time, there is no external object that exists.🔽As it was explained, how could it be ascertained, because it is not reality,🔽and how could reality be ascertained as it is?

original: de kho na nyid kyang ji lta ba bzhin du ma nges pa'i phyir ro zhes gang bshad pa dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyang ji lta ba bzhin du ma nges pa'i phyir ro zhes gang bshad pa dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And in the same way,

original: sgra don 'di dang gzhi mthun nyid //
analyzed: sgra don 'di dang gzhi mthun nyid //
translated: The meaning of the term and the common locus

original: yod pa min yang ji lta bur //
analyzed: yod pa min yang ji lta bur //
translated: Do not exist, but they are expressed

original: grags pa bzhin du brjod bya ste /
analyzed: grags pa bzhin du brjod bya ste /
translated: In accordance with what is renowned,

original: dngos la 'di ni mi srid do //🔽zhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: dngos la 'di ni mi srid do // zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: But this is not possible in reality.

original: 'o na rnam rtog gi yul gyi don ngo bo med kyang rang bzhin dang ldan pa lta bu ji ltar snang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam rtog gi yul gyi don ngo bo med kyang rang bzhin dang ldan pa lta bu ji ltar snang zhe na /
translated: Well, although the object of conceptual thought does not have an entity, how does it appear as if it has a nature?

original: ma rig pa'i bdag nyid rnam rtog gi shes pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid 'di 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i bdag nyid rnam rtog gi shes pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid 'di 'dra ba yin te /
translated: The nature of consciousnesses that are conceptual thoughts, which have the identity of ignorance, is like this.

original: bdag nyid rnam pa dang ldan par yod pa kun du ston pa nyid @238b gtan med pa'i don yang nyams su myong ba yod pa'i dngos po dang 'dra bar yod pa lta bur kun du ston pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid rnam pa dang ldan par yod pa kun du ston pa nyid @238b gtan med pa'i don yang nyams su myong ba yod pa'i dngos po dang 'dra bar yod pa lta bur kun du ston pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the appearance of something that does not exist at all as having a certain nature, as if it were something that exists.

original: shes pas med pa ston pa'i ji ltar nus de'i gsal bar byed pa'i rang bzhin yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: shes pas med pa ston pa'i ji ltar nus de'i gsal bar byed pa'i rang bzhin yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: How can cognition manifest something that does not exist? What is the nature of its manifestation?

original: med pa'i don gsal bar byed pa ni nyams su myong bas grub po //
analyzed: med pa'i don gsal bar byed pa ni nyams su myong bas grub po //
translated: The manifestation of a nonexistent object is established by experience.

original: 'di ltar gsal ba'i rang bzhin de ni shes pa ma yin shes bya yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsal ba'i rang bzhin de ni shes pa ma yin shes bya yang ma yin te /
translated: The nature of that manifestation is neither cognition nor the object of cognition.

original: de'i phyir yang med pa yin no zhes nges par nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang med pa yin no zhes nges par nus so //
translated: Therefore, it is possible to ascertain that it is nonexistent.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i de gsal bar byed pa yang nyams su myong bas grub po //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i de gsal bar byed pa yang nyams su myong bas grub po //
translated: The manifestation of conceptual cognition is also established by experience.

original: shes pa rnams kyi gsal bar byed pa ni thun mong ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa rnams kyi gsal bar byed pa ni thun mong ma yin pa ste /
translated: The manifestation of cognitions is not shared.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar 'di gsal bar byed pa yin pa de bzhin du gzhan yang yin no zhes dpe bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar 'di gsal bar byed pa yin pa de bzhin du gzhan yang yin no zhes dpe bstan par mi nus so //
translated: and thus it is not possible to demonstrate an example.

original: rnam par rtog pa bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa med pa'i don ston pa ni nyams su myong bas grub po zhes de tsam zhig ni brjod par nus so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa med pa'i don ston pa ni nyams su myong bas grub po zhes de tsam zhig ni brjod par nus so //
translated: One can only say this much: “The meaning of non-existence, which is not a conceptual cognition, is demonstrated by experience.”

original: nyams su myong ba 'di la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ni med do //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba 'di la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ni med do //
translated: There is no valid cognition that contradicts this experience.

original: de'i phyir med pa'i don gsal bar byed pa nyams su myong bas grub pa dang dpe yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa'i don gsal bar byed pa nyams su myong bas grub pa dang dpe yang med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the experience of the meaning of non-existence, which is a clarifier, is established and there is no example.

original: dper na sngon po'i sngon po nyid 'dra ba med par yang rtsod pa med par 'dzin pa de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i gsal bar byed pa yang yin no //
analyzed: dper na sngon po'i sngon po nyid 'dra ba med par yang rtsod pa med par 'dzin pa de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i gsal bar byed pa yang yin no //
translated: For example, just as the blueness of blue is apprehended without a similar example, so too is the clarifier of conceptual cognition.

original: de'i phyir don dang rang gi rang bzhin yod pa'i rig byed du nyams su myong bas grub la /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dang rang gi rang bzhin yod pa'i rig byed du nyams su myong bas grub la /
translated: Therefore, the existence of the meaning and its own nature is established by experience in the Veda.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir gang zhig gsal byed kyi dngos po'i dper 'gyur ba zhes pa dang 'dra bar gsal bar byed pa'i don ni med do //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir gang zhig gsal byed kyi dngos po'i dper 'gyur ba zhes pa dang 'dra bar gsal bar byed pa'i don ni med do //
translated: Just as it is said, “What could be the example of a thing that illuminates itself?” there is no meaning of “illumination” [in the case of self-illumination].

original: dpes ni dgos pa yang cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: dpes ni dgos pa yang cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Nor is there any purpose in an example.

original: 'di ltar nyams su myong bas grub pa'i rang bzhin la gnod par byed pa med na mi slu ba can gyi myong ba chad ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyams su myong bas grub pa'i rang bzhin la gnod par byed pa med na mi slu ba can gyi myong ba chad ma yin no //
translated: Thus, if there is no refutation of the nature that is established by experience, then experience is not deceptive.

original: de la rigs pa'am dpes bya ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de la rigs pa'am dpes bya ba ci zhig yod /
translated: What function is there of reasoning or an example in that case?

original: de nyid kyis na med pa'i don gsal bar byed pa'i phyir dang / nyams su myong bas grub pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa ma rig pa'i rang bzhin du 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na med pa'i don gsal bar byed pa'i phyir dang / nyams su myong bas grub pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa ma rig pa'i rang bzhin du 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, because it illuminates the meaning of nonexistence and because it is established by experience, it is asserted that conceptual thought has the nature of ignorance.

original: med pa'i don gsal bar byed pa nyid ma rig pa'i de kho na nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i don gsal bar byed pa nyid ma rig pa'i de kho na nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reality of ignorance is the illumination of the meaning of nonexistence.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis nges par byas pa'i yul gzung ba'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid du med pa'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid du bsgrubs pa na blo'i gzugs brnyan nyid sgra'i @239a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis nges par byas pa'i yul gzung ba'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid du med pa'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid du bsgrubs pa na blo'i gzugs brnyan nyid sgra'i @239a * //
translated: Therefore, when an object is ascertained by conceptualization, it is not the nature of the aspect of the apprehended object, and when it is established as the nature of the essential property that does not exist, the mental image itself is the object of verbal expression.🔽This is what some understand.

original: brjod bya yin no zhes 'ga' zhig rtogs pa gang yin pa de gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: brjod bya yin no zhes 'ga' zhig rtogs pa gang yin pa de gsal ba yin no //
translated: That which is conceptualized is the object of words,🔽but not the object of reflexive awareness.

original: gang zhig rnam par rtogs pa ni yul yin pa de sgra'i yul yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zhig rnam par rtogs pa ni yul yin pa de sgra'i yul yin gyi /
translated: If the object of conceptualization is ascertained, it is the object of words,

original: rang rig pa'i yul ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i yul ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the object of reflexive awareness.🔽If the object of conceptualization is ascertained, it is the object of words,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yul gang yang nges pa de yin na gzung ba'i rnam pa ni nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yul gang yang nges pa de yin na gzung ba'i rnam pa ni nges pa ma yin te /
translated: but not the object of reflexive awareness.🔽If the object of conceptualization is ascertained, it is the object of words,

original: shes pa'i cha nges pa nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i cha nges pa nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not the object of reflexive awareness.🔽If the object of conceptualization is ascertained, it is the object of words,🔽but not the object of reflexive awareness.

original: nges pa gang yin pa de ni phyi rol nyid du nges pa yin te /
analyzed: nges pa gang yin pa de ni phyi rol nyid du nges pa yin te /
translated: If the object of conceptualization is ascertained, it is the object of words,

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the object of reflexive awareness.

original: de'i phyir rang gi mngon sum gyi yul gzung ba'i rnam pa ni sgra'i don ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi mngon sum gyi yul gzung ba'i rnam pa ni sgra'i don ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the aspect of the object of one’s own perception is not the meaning of a word.

original: rnam rtog gi yul nges par byas pa me la sogs pa sgro btags par sgra rnams kyi brjod bya'i dngos por khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam rtog gi yul nges par byas pa me la sogs pa sgro btags par sgra rnams kyi brjod bya'i dngos por khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: However, one does accept that the object of conceptual consciousness, which is the superimposition of fire and so on, is the referent of the word.

original: de'i phyir de ltar blo'i gzugs brnyan yin /🔽rtog ge rig pa rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig las gzhan sel pa sgra'i don du brtags nas rtog pa med pa'i yul yang sgra'i don du lhag par zhen pa shes pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan rang gi mtshan nyid yin yang sgra'i brjod byar yongs su
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar blo'i gzugs brnyan yin / rtog ge rig pa rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig las gzhan sel pa sgra'i don du brtags nas rtog pa med pa'i yul yang sgra'i don du lhag par zhen pa shes pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan rang gi mtshan nyid yin yang sgra'i brjod byar yongs su
translated: Therefore, in that way, it is a mental image.🔽Having imagined that the referent of a word is the exclusion of other, which is a conceptual consciousness, one still clings to the object of a nonconceptual consciousness as the referent of a word.

original: brtags par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: brtags par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How could it be that, although the image is a specific characteristic, it is imagined to be the referent of a word?

original: shes pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa sgra'i brjod byar yongs su brtags par ji ltar 'gyur ro //🔽shes dang tha dad ma yin pa //
analyzed: shes pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa sgra'i brjod byar yongs su brtags par ji ltar 'gyur ro // shes dang tha dad ma yin pa //
translated: How could it be that, because it is not different from consciousness, it is imagined to be the referent of a word?

original: ji ltar don gzhan 'brang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar don gzhan 'brang bar 'gyur //
translated: How could that which is not different from consciousness🔽Be the referent of a word?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod bya yin pa slob dpon gyis bgag pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod bya yin pa slob dpon gyis bgag pa yin no //
translated: The master has refuted this and so on.🔽If the meaning of a word is a nature that is superimposed by conceptual consciousness, then the meaning of the word is indeed the nature of an affirmation.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pas sgro btags kyi rang bzhin nges par byas pas de nyid sgra'i don yin na sgrub pa'i rang bzhin sgra'i don yin mod de nges na yang me nyid chu ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan 'dogs pa ni gcig sgrub pa'i shugs kyis nges pa
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pas sgro btags kyi rang bzhin nges par byas pas de nyid sgra'i don yin na sgrub pa'i rang bzhin sgra'i don yin mod de nges na yang me nyid chu ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan 'dogs pa ni gcig sgrub pa'i shugs kyis nges pa
translated: But even if that is ascertained, since fire is not water, the superimposition of one is ascertained by the force of affirming the other.

original: yin gyi / gzhan la ldog par rtogs par byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yin gyi / gzhan la ldog par rtogs par byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the exclusion of the other is ascertained.

original: gcig nges par ma byas pa ni gzhan las ldog pa rtogs par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nges par ma byas pa ni gzhan las ldog pa rtogs par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable to ascertain the exclusion of one without ascertaining the other.

original: des na gal te sgro btags sgra'i don yin na sgrub pa'i tshul nyid du 'gyur gyi gzhan sel ba'i don du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni kha cig gi'o //
analyzed: des na gal te sgro btags sgra'i don yin na sgrub pa'i tshul nyid du 'gyur gyi gzhan sel ba'i don du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni kha cig gi'o //
translated: Therefore, if the meaning of a word is a superimposition, it would be the mode of affirmation, but it would not be the meaning of the exclusion of other. This is the position of some.

original: 'di la gal te phyi rol sreg pa'i don byed par bzod pa mthong ba ci 'dra ba kho nar rnam par rtog pas phyi rol gyi me nyid du sgro btags pa snang bar byed na ni phyi rol bzhin du nges par 'gyur gyi don dam med ces dngos
analyzed: 'di la gal te phyi rol sreg pa'i don byed par bzod pa mthong ba ci 'dra ba kho nar rnam par rtog pas phyi rol gyi me nyid du sgro btags pa snang bar byed na ni phyi rol bzhin du nges par 'gyur gyi don dam med ces dngos
translated: If, in this case, the fire that is externally resistant and capable of performing the function of burning were to appear just as it is to thought, and if thought were to superimpose the external fire on the basis of what appears to it, then the fire would be ascertained in the same way as the external object.

original: po med pa'i rnam rtog gzhan nye ba la mi ltos shing de dag dang 'brel par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: po med pa'i rnam rtog gzhan nye ba la mi ltos shing de dag dang 'brel par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not the case that the thought does not depend on the presence of another thought that is a nonentity, namely, the thought “fire does not exist ultimately.” Nor is it the case that the thought is not related to that.

original: gang gi phyir phyi rol @239b gyi mi ni dngos po yod pa la mi ltos te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyi rol @239b gyi mi ni dngos po yod pa la mi ltos te /
translated: Because the external fire does not depend on the presence of an existent entity.

original: mthong ba nyid kyi rang bzhin ni yod pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba nyid kyi rang bzhin ni yod pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of what is seen is present as the nature of an existent entity.

original: dngos po med pa la yang mi ltos te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la yang mi ltos te /
translated: Nor does it depend on the presence of a nonexistent entity.

original: mthong ba de'i rang bzhin ni med pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba de'i rang bzhin ni med pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of what is seen is incompatible with nonexistence.

original: de bzhin du mthong ba dang 'dra bar sgro btags pa yang dngos po mi 'khrul ba dang / dngos po med pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir de dag la mi ltos pa dang / de dag dang gzhi mthun nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba dang 'dra bar sgro btags pa yang dngos po mi 'khrul ba dang / dngos po med pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir de dag la mi ltos pa dang / de dag dang gzhi mthun nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, even though one superimposes the existence of a thing, it is not dependent on a non-thing, because it is not mistaken with respect to the thing, and because it is incompatible with a non-thing.

original: ji ltar chu yod do zhes shes na yang yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid la mi ltos pa de bzhin du chu yod do zhes rtogs na yang ltos pa dang 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar chu yod do zhes shes na yang yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid la mi ltos pa de bzhin du chu yod do zhes rtogs na yang ltos pa dang 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as when one knows that water exists, one does not rely on existence and nonexistence, so too, when one understands that water exists, one does not rely on existence and nonexistence.

original: shing zhes rtogs pa la ni ci yod dam med ces dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa la ltos pa dang / gcig dang 'brel ba yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: shing zhes rtogs pa la ni ci yod dam med ces dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa la ltos pa dang / gcig dang 'brel ba yang yod pa yin no //
translated: But when one understands that a tree exists, one does rely on the existence of a thing and the nonexistence of a thing, and one is related to the one and not the other.

original: de'i phyir sgrub pa dang dgag pa thun mong ba gnyis ka dang 'brel par rung ba'i don rnam par rtog pas nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di nyams su myong ba las 'ongs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgrub pa dang dgag pa thun mong ba gnyis ka dang 'brel par rung ba'i don rnam par rtog pas nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di nyams su myong ba las 'ongs pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the statement, “The object that is suitable to be related to both affirmation and negation is ascertained by conceptual thought,” is derived from experience.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po thun mong ma yin pa bsgrub pa'i rang bzhin ni don ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po thun mong ma yin pa bsgrub pa'i rang bzhin ni don ma yin no //
translated: The nature of establishing uncommon external things is not the meaning.

original: de'i phyir gnyis ka'i thun mong ba'i phyi rol dang chos mi mthun pa rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa 'di ni sgrub pa'i tshul du sgro btags par ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis ka'i thun mong ba'i phyi rol dang chos mi mthun pa rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa 'di ni sgrub pa'i tshul du sgro btags par ma mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, this superimposition by conceptualization, which is not similar to external things that are common to both, is not seen as a superimposition in the manner of establishing.

original: gang gi phyir phyi rol dang 'dra bar snang ba bsgrub pa'i rang bzhin gyi sgro btags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyi rol dang 'dra bar snang ba bsgrub pa'i rang bzhin gyi sgro btags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not a superimposition of the nature of establishing that appears similar to external things.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba'i shing la sogs pa la shing ma yin med pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba'i shing la sogs pa la shing ma yin med pa /
translated: Therefore, in the seen tree and so forth, the nature of non-affirming negation, which is the non-existence of non-tree,

original: med par dgag pa'i rang bzhin dang shing gi yod pa nyid sgrub pa'i rang bzhin kyang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: med par dgag pa'i rang bzhin dang shing gi yod pa nyid sgrub pa'i rang bzhin kyang yod pa yin no //
translated: and the nature of affirming negation, which is the existence of the tree itself, also exist.

original: de la rnam par rtog pas ni bsgrub pa'i rang bzhin la reg pa'am sgrub pa dang 'dra bar sgro btags ni mi nus kyi /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pas ni bsgrub pa'i rang bzhin la reg pa'am sgrub pa dang 'dra bar sgro btags ni mi nus kyi /
translated: Regarding that, conceptualization cannot touch the nature of establishing or superimpose it as similar to establishing.

original: 'on kyang shing ma yin med pas khyad par du gyur pa shing ma yin med pa'i mthar thug pa'i shing sgro 'dogs par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang shing ma yin med pas khyad par du gyur pa shing ma yin med pa'i mthar thug pa'i shing sgro 'dogs par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: But since there is no non-tree, the tree is merely imagined to be the ultimate non-non-tree.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa phyi rol dang mi mthun la sgro 'dogs par byed kyang phyi rol lta bur kun tu ston pa yin //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa phyi rol dang mi mthun la sgro 'dogs par byed kyang phyi rol lta bur kun tu ston pa yin //
translated: Therefore, the imagination is not in accord with external things, but it does appear as if it were.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa thun mong ba'i shing ni phyi rol na med la rnam par rtog pa ni gnyis ka'i thun mong ba kun tu ston par byed do //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa thun mong ba'i shing ni phyi rol na med la rnam par rtog pa ni gnyis ka'i thun mong ba kun tu ston par byed do //
translated: The tree, which is common to both things and non-things, does not exist externally, but the imagination does appear as if it were common to both.

original: des na phyi rol dang chos mi mthun par nges pa yin no //🔽gcig la @240a * //
analyzed: des na phyi rol dang chos mi mthun par nges pa yin no // gcig la @240a * //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that it is not in accord with external things.

original: ni gcig med pa'i dngos po ni phyir rol na yod la de'i khyad par can du yang sgro btags pa yin te /
analyzed: ni gcig med pa'i dngos po ni phyir rol na yod la de'i khyad par can du yang sgro btags pa yin te /
translated: The non-existence of one thing in another does exist externally, and the imagination is superimposed upon it as having that as a distinguishing feature.

original: de'i phyir sgro btags pa'i phyi rol ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgro btags pa'i phyi rol ston pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it appears as if it were an external superimposition.

original: de'i phyir da ltar ni mthong ba'i mi rnam par rtog par mi byed do zhes mthong ba dang brtags pa bye brag phyed par rtogs kyang mthong ba dang brtags pa'i don dag gcig tu byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir da ltar ni mthong ba'i mi rnam par rtog par mi byed do zhes mthong ba dang brtags pa bye brag phyed par rtogs kyang mthong ba dang brtags pa'i don dag gcig tu byed pa nyid do //
translated: Even though one understands the distinction between seeing and imagining, one makes the objects of seeing and imagining into one.

original: gang gi phyir gcig tu byas pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yul mthong ba'i me nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gcig tu byas pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yul mthong ba'i me nges pa yin no //
translated: Because one makes them into one, the object of non-imagination is ascertained as fire.

original: gang gi phyir sgro btags pa la mthong ba'i me'i rang bzhin du zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgro btags pa la mthong ba'i me'i rang bzhin du zhe na /
translated: Why is it that one does not imagine the nature of fire that is seen in the superimposition?

original: yang rnam par mi rtog go zhes rnam par rtog pas snang ba'i me'i rang bzhin yul du zhen pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang rnam par mi rtog go zhes rnam par rtog pas snang ba'i me'i rang bzhin yul du zhen pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: One does not imagine it means that the nature of fire that appears to imagination is conceived as an object, but not otherwise.

original: de'i phyir shing ma yin med pa'i mthar thug pa'i rang bzhin lhag par nges pa las phyi rol dang chos mi mthun par nges kyang phyi rol nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir shing ma yin med pa'i mthar thug pa'i rang bzhin lhag par nges pa las phyi rol dang chos mi mthun par nges kyang phyi rol nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though one ascertains the nature of the fire that is not wood as the ultimate, and ascertains the external as contradictory to that, the external is ascertained.

original: yang gang dag sgra ni so sor nges pa'i dngos po'i cha la 'jug pa yin la rnam rtog kyang de bzhin no zer ba de dag la 'di skad ces dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang gang dag sgra ni so sor nges pa'i dngos po'i cha la 'jug pa yin la rnam rtog kyang de bzhin no zer ba de dag la 'di skad ces dri bar bya ste /
translated: Also, those who say that sound engages the part of a thing that is individually determined, and that conceptual thought is also like that, should be asked this:

original: ci 'dra ba mthong ba de 'dra ba nyid 'dzin na ni cha'i dbye ba chung zad kyang ma bzung la /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba mthong ba de 'dra ba nyid 'dzin na ni cha'i dbye ba chung zad kyang ma bzung la /
translated: If it is just as it is seen, then it is just as it is apprehended, and not the slightest part is not apprehended.

original: gzhan 'dra bar rtog na ni sgro btags pa dngos po nges pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan 'dra bar rtog na ni sgro btags pa dngos po nges pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is imagined to be like something else, then the superimposition is not a definite thing.

original: gal te gcig las ldog pa'i mthar thug pa'i phyi rol du ma mthong ba de lta na yang shing ma yin med pa de srid du phyi rol grub po //
analyzed: gal te gcig las ldog pa'i mthar thug pa'i phyi rol du ma mthong ba de lta na yang shing ma yin med pa de srid du phyi rol grub po //
translated: Even if one does not see a multiplicity of external things that are the ultimate in being the opposite of one, so long as one does not see the nonexistence of a non-tree, the external is established.

original: de'i mthar thug pa'i rang bzhin gzung na ni phyi rol gyi rang bzhin nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i mthar thug pa'i rang bzhin gzung na ni phyi rol gyi rang bzhin nges par 'gyur te /
translated: If one apprehends the nature of the ultimate, then the nature of the external is ascertained.

original: sgro btags pa'i don ni phyi rol gyi shing ma yin med pa'i khyad par can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i don ni phyi rol gyi shing ma yin med pa'i khyad par can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the object of superimposition is qualified by the nonexistence of a non-tree that is external.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi shing ma bzung na de'i mthar thug pa'i shing ma yin pa med pa yang gzung bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi shing ma bzung na de'i mthar thug pa'i shing ma yin pa med pa yang gzung bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If the external tree is not apprehended, is not the non-tree, which is its opposite, apprehended?

original: bden na 'on kyang sgro btags kyi shing shing gi bdag nyid ma yin kyang shing ma yin med pa'i mthar thug pa sgro 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: bden na 'on kyang sgro btags kyi shing shing gi bdag nyid ma yin kyang shing ma yin med pa'i mthar thug pa sgro 'dogs par byed do //
translated: It is true, but the superimposed tree, although not having the nature of a tree, is superimposed as the non-tree, which is the opposite of a tree.

original: de'i phyir sgro btags kyi shing ma yin med pa nges par rtogs pa nges par bya ba'i phyi rol nges par byed pa yin no //🔽shing ma yin med pa'i khyad par can sgro btags pa la 'di shing ngo shes phyi rol nyid du nges pa nyid phyi rol gyi don nges pa yin gyi dngos su phyi rol gyi //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgro btags kyi shing ma yin med pa nges par rtogs pa nges par bya ba'i phyi rol nges par byed pa yin no // shing ma yin med pa'i khyad par can sgro btags pa la 'di shing ngo shes phyi rol nyid du nges pa nyid phyi rol gyi don nges pa yin gyi dngos su phyi rol gyi //
translated: Therefore, the ascertainment of the superimposed non-tree is the ascertainment of the external object.

original: shing ma yin med pa rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shing ma yin med pa rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The ascertainment of the external object is the ascertainment of the external object, although the ascertainment of the superimposed non-tree is the ascertainment of the external object, it is not the direct ascertainment of the external tree.

original: phyi rol gyi don ma bzung na de nges par @240b gzhan gyis stong par mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don ma bzung na de nges par @240b gzhan gyis stong par mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, if the external object is not apprehended, one does not ascertain that it is empty of another.

original: de bzhin du sgra ni rtag pa ma yin no zhes 'gog pa'i tshe na rtag pa nyid sgra dang gzhi mthun par rtogs la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra ni rtag pa ma yin no zhes 'gog pa'i tshe na rtag pa nyid sgra dang gzhi mthun par rtogs la /
translated: Likewise, when one refutes sound as permanent, one understands permanence as a common locus with sound.

original: gzhi mthun pa yang gcig la brjod do //
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa yang gcig la brjod do //
translated: And a common locus is expressed as one.

original: dngos po gang zhig gang dang lhan cig tu mthong ba de ma bzlog par ni cig shos bzlog par mi nus na /
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig gang dang lhan cig tu mthong ba de ma bzlog par ni cig shos bzlog par mi nus na /
translated: When one cannot refute one of two things without seeing the other,

original: sgra gnas kyang gzhi mthun pa'i rtag pa nyid 'gog ste /
analyzed: sgra gnas kyang gzhi mthun pa'i rtag pa nyid 'gog ste /
translated: then even though sound is a common locus, one refutes permanence.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol dang mi 'dra ba nges pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol dang mi 'dra ba nges pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is certain that it is not like external things.

original: des na dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang 'brel bar rung ba rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang 'brel bar rung ba rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And thus, because one understands that it is suitable to be related to an existent or a non-existent,

original: gzhi mthun pa'i chos gzhan bgag kyang ma bgag pa'i phyir gzhan las ldog pa'i mthar thug pa'i rang bzhin kho na rnam par rtog pas nges par byed do //
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa'i chos gzhan bgag kyang ma bgag pa'i phyir gzhan las ldog pa'i mthar thug pa'i rang bzhin kho na rnam par rtog pas nges par byed do //
translated: even though one refutes another phenomenon that is a common locus, because one does not refute the other, one ascertains by means of a conceptual cognition the nature that is the final exclusion of the other.

original: gal te dgag pa'i shes pa phyi rol la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te dgag pa'i shes pa phyi rol la ni ma yin te /
translated: If the cognition of negation is not with respect to an external object,

original: de mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then it is not an external object because it does not appear.

original: blo dang bzung ba'i rnam pa la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: blo dang bzung ba'i rnam pa la yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it in the cognition or the image apprehended,

original: de gnyis ni nyams su myong bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni nyams su myong bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those two are themselves the experience.

original: sgro btags pa la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgro btags pa la yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it in the superimposition,

original: de yang de'i tshe sgro btags kyi rang bzhin du gzung ba dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang de'i tshe sgro btags kyi rang bzhin du gzung ba dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time the nature of the superimposition cannot be apprehended and refuted.

original: de bzhin du sgrub pa'i shes pa yang phyi rol la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgrub pa'i shes pa yang phyi rol la ni ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the cognition of establishment is not in the external,

original: mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not appear.

original: blo la sogs pa rnams kyang yod pa la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir 'di dgag pa mi rigs ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: blo la sogs pa rnams kyang yod pa la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir 'di dgag pa mi rigs ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is it not reasonable to refute the existence of the external, cognition, and so on, because they are not without error?

original: bden te / phyi rol dang blo dang rnam pa dang sgro btags pa la yang dgag pa dang sgrub par rtog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bden te / phyi rol dang blo dang rnam pa dang sgro btags pa la yang dgag pa dang sgrub par rtog pa ma yin no //
translated: It is true, but the refutation and establishment are not conceived in the external, cognition, image, and superimposition.

original: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag ni sgro btags gang zhig phyi rol nyid du nges par byas pa de dang 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag ni sgro btags gang zhig phyi rol nyid du nges par byas pa de dang 'brel pa yin te /
translated: The establishment and refutation are related to that superimposition which is ascertained as external.

original: dper na sbrul sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i shes pa thag pa'i rdzas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na sbrul sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i shes pa thag pa'i rdzas ni ma yin te /
translated: For example, the substance of the rope is not the cognition that establishes or denies the snake,

original: mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not appear.

original: sbrul gyi blo dang gzung ba'i rnam pa dang / sgro btags kyi sbrul la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sbrul gyi blo dang gzung ba'i rnam pa dang / sgro btags kyi sbrul la yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the cognition of the snake, the form that is grasped, or the superimposed snake,

original: de dag ni rang gi rang bzhin du yod pa la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rang gi rang bzhin du yod pa la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those are not confused about their own nature.

original: 'on kyang sgro btags kyi sbrul gang zhig phyi rol gyi sbrul nyid du nges par byas pa de ni sgrub pa dang dgag par nges pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgro btags kyi sbrul gang zhig phyi rol gyi sbrul nyid du nges par byas pa de ni sgrub pa dang dgag par nges pa bzhin no //
translated: However, the superimposed snake is ascertained as the external snake itself, just as the ascertainment of establishment and denial.

original: gang zhig dngos po dang dngos po med pa thun mong du zhen pas nges par 'dzin pa de ni gcig las ldog pa nges pa lhur byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig dngos po dang dngos po med pa thun mong du zhen pas nges par 'dzin pa de ni gcig las ldog pa nges pa lhur byed pa yin te /
translated: One who ascertains by conceiving the commonality of entity and non-entity is intent on ascertaining the negation of one.

original: dper na bum pa ma yin par shes pas bum pa ma yin par nges par 'dzin pa na yod dam med ces dngos po dang dngos po med pa thun mong du nges par 'dzin par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa ma yin par shes pas bum pa ma yin par nges par 'dzin pa na yod dam med ces dngos po dang dngos po med pa thun mong du nges par 'dzin par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when one ascertains the non-existence of a pot by the cognition of the non-existence of a pot, one ascertains the commonality of entity and non-entity, asking whether it exists or not.

original: @241a * // rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis kyang dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gi rang bzhin thun mong du nges par 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: @241a * // rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis kyang dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gi rang bzhin thun mong du nges par 'dzin par byed do //
translated: All conceptualizations also apprehend the nature of things and nonthings in common.

original: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This reason is not unestablished,

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis ka'i thun mong gi rang bzhin du dmigs par nyams su myong bas grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis ka'i thun mong gi rang bzhin du dmigs par nyams su myong bas grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established by experience that the nature of both conceptualizations is apprehended in common.

original: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis thun mong du 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gcig la ldog pa lhur nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis thun mong du 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gcig la ldog pa lhur nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: The reason for the common apprehension, as explained earlier, is that the exclusion is ascertained in dependence on the thing.

original: de ni rgyu mtshan med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni rgyu mtshan med pa ma yin la /
translated: That is not without a reason,

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because another reason is not observed.

original: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug na khyad par byed pa rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa nyid med par 'gyur ba'i phyir khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa na thun mong du 'dzin pa ldog pa gcig gi mthar thug pa
analyzed: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug na khyad par byed pa rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa nyid med par 'gyur ba'i phyir khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa na thun mong du 'dzin pa ldog pa gcig gi mthar thug pa
translated: Therefore, when it turns away from the discordant class, it is restricted to a single cessation of the apprehension of commonness.

original: la gnas pa'i phyir khyab pa grub po //
analyzed: la gnas pa'i phyir khyab pa grub po //
translated: Thus, the pervasion is established.

original: gzhan yang mi bden pa'i rang bzhin ston pa'i rnam par rtog pa phyi rol 'dra ba kun du ston par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang mi bden pa'i rang bzhin ston pa'i rnam par rtog pa phyi rol 'dra ba kun du ston par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, how could a conceptual cognition that reveals an unreal nature manifest as if it were external?

original: de gnyis ni shin tu chos mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni shin tu chos mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those two are utterly dissimilar.

original: de'i phyir de'i rang bzhin gzhan las ldog par zhen pa na rnam par rtog pa phyi rol 'dra bar kun du ston par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rang bzhin gzhan las ldog par zhen pa na rnam par rtog pa phyi rol 'dra bar kun du ston par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, when it is ascertained that its nature is different from that, it is a conceptual cognition that manifests as if it were external.

original: gang zhig shin tu mi 'dra ba de'i rang bzhin du 'dzin pa de ni gzhan las bzlog pas byas pa'i 'dra bar 'dzin pa lhur len pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig shin tu mi 'dra ba de'i rang bzhin du 'dzin pa de ni gzhan las bzlog pas byas pa'i 'dra bar 'dzin pa lhur len pa yin te /
translated: That which is utterly dissimilar is apprehended as having that nature, and that is the apprehension of similarity that is produced by the exclusion of other.

original: dper na snam bu bum pa dang shin tu mi 'dra yang shing ma yin par khyad par can du nges par rtogs pa na 'di yang shing ma yin na 'di yang shing ma yin zhes yin na bum pa dang 'dra bar nges par rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na snam bu bum pa dang shin tu mi 'dra yang shing ma yin par khyad par can du nges par rtogs pa na 'di yang shing ma yin na 'di yang shing ma yin zhes yin na bum pa dang 'dra bar nges par rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, although cloth is very different from a pot, when one understands that it is ascertained as a particular that is not a tree, one ascertains that if it is not a tree, it is also not a tree.

original: de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i don phyi rol dang shin tu mi mthun pa yang phyi rol du nges par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i don phyi rol dang shin tu mi mthun pa yang phyi rol du nges par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, although the object of conceptual thought is very different from external reality, it is ascertained as external reality.

original: rnam par rtog pas phyi rol nges par byed pa yang nyams su myong bas grub po //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas phyi rol nges par byed pa yang nyams su myong bas grub po //
translated: That conceptual thought ascertains external reality is established by experience.

original: dngos po med pa la phyi rol du 'dzin pa ni rgyu mtshan med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la phyi rol du 'dzin pa ni rgyu mtshan med pa ma yin te /
translated: The apprehension of non-entity as external is not without a basis.

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan yang med de /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan yang med de /
translated: There is no other basis.

original: ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: It is just as explained.

original: de'i phyir gzhan las ldog pa ni 'dzin na khyab par byed pa rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa med pa'i phyir phyi rol du 'dzin pa nyid ldog pa na gzhan las ldog pas byas pas phyi rol nyid du 'dzin pa gnas pa'i phyir khyab ba grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan las ldog pa ni 'dzin na khyab par byed pa rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa med pa'i phyir phyi rol du 'dzin pa nyid ldog pa na gzhan las ldog pas byas pas phyi rol nyid du 'dzin pa gnas pa'i phyir khyab ba grub po //
translated: Therefore, when apprehending the exclusion from other, since there is no reason for the pervasion, when apprehending external objects, the exclusion from other is done, and thus apprehending external objects remains.

original: gzhan yang sgrub pa'i tshul gyis rnam par brtags pa don yin no zhes smra bas ni @241b rnam par rtog pa gzhan las ldog pa shugs kyis nges par byed pa yin no zhes gsal bar smras par gyur na de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrub pa'i tshul gyis rnam par brtags pa don yin no zhes smra bas ni @241b rnam par rtog pa gzhan las ldog pa shugs kyis nges par byed pa yin no zhes gsal bar smras par gyur na de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, when one who advocates that the object of conceptual thought is established by the mode of affirmation implicitly ascertains the exclusion from other, he clearly states that. But that is illogical.

original: gang gi phyir gcig pa grub par rtogs pa'i dus su de cig shog las ldog par ma rtogs na bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par rtog pa'i don de nyid nges par rnam par brtag mi nus te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gcig pa grub par rtogs pa'i dus su de cig shog las ldog par ma rtogs na bsgrub pa'i tshul rnam par rtog pa'i don de nyid nges par rnam par brtag mi nus te /
translated: Because when one realizes the establishment of the one, if one does not realize the exclusion from other, one cannot ascertain the object of conceptual thought that is established by the mode of affirmation.

original: cig shos kyi rang bzhin la the tshom za na der rnam par brtag par bya ba la yang the tshom za bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig shos kyi rang bzhin la the tshom za na der rnam par brtag par bya ba la yang the tshom za bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one doubts the nature of the one, then one doubts the conceptualization of the other.

original: phyi nas bzlog par bya ba la der the tshom mi za'o zhes kyang brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: phyi nas bzlog par bya ba la der the tshom mi za'o zhes kyang brjod par mi nus te /
translated: Nor can one say that one does not doubt the conceptualization of the other, because

original: de'i phyir cig shos kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni nges pa'i don rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir cig shos kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni nges pa'i don rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: the conceptualization that understands the emptiness of the nature of the one is the one that understands the definitive meaning.

original: gang zhig nges pa'i rang bzhin nges par rtogs par byed pa de ni gzhan las ldog pa'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig nges pa'i rang bzhin nges par rtogs par byed pa de ni gzhan las ldog pa'i yul can yin te /
translated: That which understands the definitive nature is the one that has the object of the exclusion of the other,

original: dper na 'di ni bum pa kho na'o zhes nges pa nyid kyi bum pa nges par rtogs pa'i rtog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'di ni bum pa kho na'o zhes nges pa nyid kyi bum pa nges par rtogs pa'i rtog pa bzhin no //
translated: just as, for example, the conceptualization that understands the pot as just pot is the one that is definite as pot.

original: de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyang nges pa nyid du 'dzin par nyams su myong bas grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyang nges pa nyid du 'dzin par nyams su myong bas grub pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, all conceptualizations are experienced as just the grasping of the definite.

original: 'dir yang sngar bshad pa'i rnam par nges par 'dzin pa rgyu mtshan med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dir yang sngar bshad pa'i rnam par nges par 'dzin pa rgyu mtshan med pa ma yin la /
translated: Here, the ascertainment explained previously is not without a reason.

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa nyid med pa'i phyir nges par 'dzin pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pas na ldog pa dang ldan pa 'dzin pa nyid la gnas pas na khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa nyid med pa'i phyir nges par 'dzin pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pas na ldog pa dang ldan pa 'dzin pa nyid la gnas pas na khyab pa yin no //
translated: And because another reason is not tenable, since the pervader is not tenable, the ascertainment is the opposite of the discordant side. Since it is the ascertainment that has the opposite, it is the pervasion.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa nyid thun mong du 'dzin pa dang phyi rol du 'dzin pa dang / nges par 'dzin pa de nyid ni ldog pa 'dzin pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa nyid thun mong du 'dzin pa dang phyi rol du 'dzin pa dang / nges par 'dzin pa de nyid ni ldog pa 'dzin pa kho na yin te /
translated: The ascertainment of the existence and nonexistence of things in common, the ascertainment of external things, and the ascertainment of reality are the ascertainment of the opposite.

original: de'i phyir khyab par byed pa yin par blta'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyab par byed pa yin par blta'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be viewed as the pervader.

original: gal te dngos po gzhan las ldog par sgro btags pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po gzhan las ldog par sgro btags pa yin na /
translated: If it is a superimposition that is the opposite of another thing,

original: ldog pa gang yin pa de dang / ldog mtshams gang yin pa de dang / rgyu mtshan gang gis ldog pa de gsum ka yang rnam par rtog pas rtogs par bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ldog pa gang yin pa de dang / ldog mtshams gang yin pa de dang / rgyu mtshan gang gis ldog pa de gsum ka yang rnam par rtog pas rtogs par bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: The three—the object of negation, the point at which the negation stops, and the reason for the negation—are all to be understood through conceptual thought.

original: dper na lha sbyin mchod sbyin las ldog par 'dzin pa na gsum ka yang 'dzin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin mchod sbyin las ldog par 'dzin pa na gsum ka yang 'dzin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when one apprehends Devadatta as not performing a sacrifice, all three are apprehended.

original: dngos po med pa'i phyir ji skad bshad pa gsum ni rnam par rtog bas 'dzin par mi 'thad cing nyams su myong ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i phyir ji skad bshad pa gsum ni rnam par rtog bas 'dzin par mi 'thad cing nyams su myong ba yang ma yin no //
translated: But because of the nonexistence of the object, the three as explained are not tenable as apprehended by conceptual thought, nor are they experienced.
