original: nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i rang rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin par yang rtag par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i rang rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin par yang rtag par mi 'thad do //
translated: And it is not tenable that a conceptual thought that is not of the nature of experience is a reflexive awareness.

original: @242a * // de'i phyir gzhan sel ba'i rang bzhin du sgro btags pa zhes bya bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: @242a * // de'i phyir gzhan sel ba'i rang bzhin du sgro btags pa zhes bya bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how could it be said that it is a superimposition of the nature of an other-exclusion?

original: rnam par rtog pa ni ma rig pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin par mi nus so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni ma rig pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin par mi nus so //
translated: Conceptual thought is of the nature of ignorance and therefore is not able to apprehend its own characteristics.

original: ci zhig ltar don byed par sgro 'dogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: ci zhig ltar don byed par sgro 'dogs par byed pa ni /
translated: What is the superimposition of some sort of causal efficiency?

original: gang gi phyir yod pa dang med pa dang 'brel par rung pa dang phyi rol nyid dang nges pa lta bur sgro 'dogs pa de'i phyir gzhan las ldog pa'i mthar thug pa nyid du sgro 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yod pa dang med pa dang 'brel par rung pa dang phyi rol nyid dang nges pa lta bur sgro 'dogs pa de'i phyir gzhan las ldog pa'i mthar thug pa nyid du sgro 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: Because there is the superimposition of existence, nonexistence, the possibility of a relation, externality, and certainty, therefore there is the superimposition of the ultimate in the form of the exclusion of other.

original: 'di ltar ldog pa gtsor gyur pa'i don sgro btags na shing ma yin pa las ldog par bzung ba'i shing gi de nyid yod pa dang med pa las ldog par nges pa'i phyir yod pa dang med pa la ltos par rig pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar ldog pa gtsor gyur pa'i don sgro btags na shing ma yin pa las ldog par bzung ba'i shing gi de nyid yod pa dang med pa las ldog par nges pa'i phyir yod pa dang med pa la ltos par rig pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when there is the superimposition of an object that is primarily an exclusion, the reality of a tree, which is apprehended as the exclusion of non-tree, is known to be dependent on existence and nonexistence, because it is ascertained as the exclusion of existence and nonexistence.

original: de bzhin du cig shos ldog pa'i mthar thug pa nyid rtogs na nges par 'dzin pa yin la de bzhin du gzhan las ldog pa rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du cig shos ldog pa'i mthar thug pa nyid rtogs na nges par 'dzin pa yin la de bzhin du gzhan las ldog pa rtogs par 'gyur na /
translated: Similarly, when the ultimate in the form of the exclusion of the other is understood, there is the apprehension of certainty. And in the same way, when the exclusion of other is understood,

original: phyi rol dang shin tu mi 'dra ba de yang phyi rol nyid du 'dzin par 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol dang shin tu mi 'dra ba de yang phyi rol nyid du 'dzin par 'thad pa yin no //
translated: it is tenable that that which is quite unlike the external is apprehended as external.

original: de'i phyir gzhan las ldog pa'i rang bzhin nyid sgro 'dogs pa yin na yod pa dang med pa dang 'brel par rung ba dang nges par 'dzin pa dang don byed par bzod pa'i rang bzhin phyi rol lta bur zhen pa yin no zhes nges par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan las ldog pa'i rang bzhin nyid sgro 'dogs pa yin na yod pa dang med pa dang 'brel par rung ba dang nges par 'dzin pa dang don byed par bzod pa'i rang bzhin phyi rol lta bur zhen pa yin no zhes nges par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, if the nature that is the opposite of other is reified, it should be ascertained that one is conceiving the nature of external objects that are related to existence and nonexistence, that are capable of being apprehended as ascertained, and that are able to perform functions.

original: gal te bdag gis gzhan las ldog pa rtogs so zhes rtogs par byed pa la zhen pa med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bdag gis gzhan las ldog pa rtogs so zhes rtogs par byed pa la zhen pa med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “Is there not a conception that conceives the apprehension of the opposite of other as the self?”

original: dper na spyi dang ldan pa'i don mthong ngo zhes gsal ba dang spyi dang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos por nyams su myong ba'i rtogs pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na spyi dang ldan pa'i don mthong ngo zhes gsal ba dang spyi dang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos por nyams su myong ba'i rtogs pa med mod kyi /
translated: For example, when it is said, “I see an object that possesses a universal,” there is no conception that experiences a universal, a particular, or the state of possessing a particular.

original: 'on kyang khyad par can gyi rtogs pa'i dbang gis spyi'i khyad par can gyi gsal ba mthong bar pha rol gyis brtags pa de bzhin du yod pa dang med pa dang 'brel par rung ba dang nges par 'dzin pa dang / phyi rol dang 'dra bar sgro 'dogs pa gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang khyad par can gyi rtogs pa'i dbang gis spyi'i khyad par can gyi gsal ba mthong bar pha rol gyis brtags pa de bzhin du yod pa dang med pa dang 'brel par rung ba dang nges par 'dzin pa dang / phyi rol dang 'dra bar sgro 'dogs pa gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: But just as the opponent imagines that the special cognition sees a special universal, in the same way, it is not tenable to superimpose a connection with existence and nonexistence, to apprehend with certainty, and to superimpose something like an external object.

original: gzhan las ldog par sgro btags so zhes brjod kyi rnam par rtog pa bdag nyid ni ldog pa dang ldan pa rtogs pa yin no zhes nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan las ldog par sgro btags so zhes brjod kyi rnam par rtog pa bdag nyid ni ldog pa dang ldan pa rtogs pa yin no zhes nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the superimposition is of something different, but it is not certain that the thought itself is the cognition of something that possesses difference.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni ldog pa dang ldan pa'o zhes rnam par rtog pa na nges par gsum char brtag par 'gyur ba ldog pa dang ldog mtshams dang ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan rnams tha dad du brtag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni ldog pa dang ldan pa'o zhes rnam par rtog pa na nges par gsum char brtag par 'gyur ba ldog pa dang ldog mtshams dang ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan rnams tha dad du brtag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: For that reason, when one thinks, “This possesses difference,” it is not necessary to imagine all three—difference, the boundary of difference, and the reason for difference—as different.

original: 'dir ni gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'i rang bzhin gyis don byed par rnam par @242b rtog par byed pa nyid shugs kyis gzhan las ldog par rtogs par byed pa nyid shugs kyis ldog par rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir gsum du rtogs par thal
analyzed: 'dir ni gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'i rang bzhin gyis don byed par rnam par @242b rtog par byed pa nyid shugs kyis gzhan las ldog par rtogs par byed pa nyid shugs kyis ldog par rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir gsum du rtogs par thal
translated: But here, since it is said that the conception of the object’s function is by way of its nature that is not shared with others, the conception of the object’s exclusion from other things is implicitly understood.

original: ba med do //
analyzed: ba med do //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that it follows that there are three conceptions.

original: gal te dngos po don gcig byed pas gzhan de mi byed pa dag las ldog par brtag par byas pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po don gcig byed pas gzhan de mi byed pa dag las ldog par brtag par byas pa yin na /
translated: If the object’s function is conceived by way of its exclusion from other things that do not perform that function,

original: gang gi tshe 'bras bu mthong bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe ni de byed par gzung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'bras bu mthong bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe ni de byed par gzung bar 'gyur na /
translated: then when the effect is seen, it is apprehended as its cause.

original: sngar ma mthong ba'i dngos po la go mthong ba'i de ma thag pa'i zhen pas mthong ba'i rang bzhin dngos po gzhan las ldog par 'dzin pa ci 'dra ba zhig yin /
analyzed: sngar ma mthong ba'i dngos po la go mthong ba'i de ma thag pa'i zhen pas mthong ba'i rang bzhin dngos po gzhan las ldog par 'dzin pa ci 'dra ba zhig yin /
translated: But prior to seeing the effect, how can the nature of the object that is seen be apprehended by way of its exclusion from other things that are not seen?

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu'i khyad par byed pas na rnam par rtog pas de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las ldog pa'i rang bzhin du gsal bar byed pa yin no /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu'i khyad par byed pas na rnam par rtog pas de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las ldog pa'i rang bzhin du gsal bar byed pa yin no /
translated: Because it produces a specific result, conception clarifies the nature of things that are not its result, in terms of being excluded from those that are not its result.

original: de'i tshe ni 'bras bu 'ga' zhig kyang mthong ba med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni 'bras bu 'ga' zhig kyang mthong ba med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: At that time, no result is seen at all.

original: ji ltar mthong ba med pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba med pa yin /
translated: How is it that it is not seen?

original: gang gi tshe rtogs pa po snang ba'i 'bras bu mthong ba nyid nyams su myong nas snang ba la mthong ba de byed par nges pa yin pa de'i phyir snang ba mthong ba de byed pa ma yin pa dag las ldog par rnam par rtog pas nges pa
analyzed: gang gi tshe rtogs pa po snang ba'i 'bras bu mthong ba nyid nyams su myong nas snang ba la mthong ba de byed par nges pa yin pa de'i phyir snang ba mthong ba de byed pa ma yin pa dag las ldog par rnam par rtog pas nges pa
translated: When the cognizer experiences seeing the result of illumination, he ascertains that illumination is the cause of seeing. Therefore, conception ascertains that illumination is excluded from those that are not the cause of seeing.

original: yin no // gal te dngos po bzhin du mthong ba yang tha dad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yin no // gal te dngos po bzhin du mthong ba yang tha dad pa ma yin nam /
translated: If, like things, seeing is not different,

original: de'i phyir dngos po mthong ba de byed pas de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las ldog par nges pa na mthong ba tha dad pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig kyang 'ga' zhig dang yang mtshungs par rtogs par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po mthong ba de byed pas de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las ldog par nges pa na mthong ba tha dad pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig kyang 'ga' zhig dang yang mtshungs par rtogs par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Therefore, since the seeing of the thing is the effect of that, when it is ascertained that it is the opposite of those which do not have that effect, then because the seeing is different, it is not the case that any one is understood to be the same as any other.

original: shing la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin mtshungs pa cung zhig rnams rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa ni yin no zhe na /
analyzed: shing la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin mtshungs pa cung zhig rnams rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa ni yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is the case that some of the trees, etc., which are similar in nature are understood by conceptual thought.

original: bden te / bye brag rnams so sor tha dad pa la mthong ba tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: bden te / bye brag rnams so sor tha dad pa la mthong ba tha dad pa yin no //
translated: That is true, but the differences are individually different, and the seeing is different.

original: mthong ba'i de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i nges par byed pas ni tha dad pa med par zhen par byed do //
analyzed: mthong ba'i de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i nges par byed pas ni tha dad pa med par zhen par byed do //
translated: The ascertainment that occurs immediately after seeing causes the non-difference to be apprehended.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba gcig byed pa'i gsal ba rnams 'bras bu de mi byed pa dag las ldog pa rang bzhin mtshungs par rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba gcig byed pa'i gsal ba rnams 'bras bu de mi byed pa dag las ldog pa rang bzhin mtshungs par rtogs par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the manifestation that performs the one seeing is understood to be the same in nature as the opposite of those that do not perform that effect.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa ji ltar gsal ba tha dad pa gcig byed par nges par bzung nas de mi byed pa dag las ldog pas tha mi dad par nges par byed pa de bzhin du mthong ba rnams kyang 'bras bu gcig pa nyid kyis de'i 'bras
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa ji ltar gsal ba tha dad pa gcig byed par nges par bzung nas de mi byed pa dag las ldog pas tha mi dad par nges par byed pa de bzhin du mthong ba rnams kyang 'bras bu gcig pa nyid kyis de'i 'bras
translated: If you determine that a single clear conception is the cause of a single effect and you determine that it is not different from that effect because it is the opposite of that which does not perform that function, then in the same way, seeing would be determined to be not different from its effect because it has a single effect.🔽

original: bu can ma yin pa dag las ldog pa nges par gzung ba na tha dad pa med par nges par 'gyur dgos na /🔽ji ltar gsal @243a * //
analyzed: bu can ma yin pa dag las ldog pa nges par gzung ba na tha dad pa med par nges par 'gyur dgos na / ji ltar gsal @243a * //
translated: If you determine that the various clear cognitions are the same in that they perform a single function and you determine that they are not different because they are the opposite of not performing that function, then in the same way, since the various perceptions have the same effect, you would have to determine that they are not different because they are the opposite of not having that effect.🔽But you do not see that they have the same effect.

original: ba rnams 'bras bu tha mi dad pa de bzhin du mthong ba rnams la 'bras bu tha mi dad pa cung zad cig mthong na ni med do //
analyzed: ba rnams 'bras bu tha mi dad pa de bzhin du mthong ba rnams la 'bras bu tha mi dad pa cung zad cig mthong na ni med do //
translated: If you see that the various clear cognitions have the same effect, then you would see that the various perceptions have the same effect, but you do not see that.

original: de lta na ni 'o na mthong ba'i stobs kyis 'byung ba'i rtog pa nyid mthong ba'i 'bras bu yin par mthong bas na 'bras bu gzhan gyis ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na mthong ba'i stobs kyis 'byung ba'i rtog pa nyid mthong ba'i 'bras bu yin par mthong bas na 'bras bu gzhan gyis ci bya zhe na /
translated: In that case, since you see that the very conception that arises by the power of seeing is the effect of seeing, what is the use of another effect?

original: de ltar ni mi nus te /
analyzed: de ltar ni mi nus te /
translated: That is not possible.

original: ji ltar gsal ba rnams dang / mthong ba rnams tha dad pa de bzhin du mthong ba'i mthu las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyang tha dad do //
analyzed: ji ltar gsal ba rnams dang / mthong ba rnams tha dad pa de bzhin du mthong ba'i mthu las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyang tha dad do //
translated: Just as the cognitions and the seen are different, so too the conceptual thoughts that arise from the power of seeing are different.

original: de'i phyir de dag gis gcig nyid kyang rgyu mtshan 'bras bu gzhan la brten par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gis gcig nyid kyang rgyu mtshan 'bras bu gzhan la brten par bya ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, even though they are one, the reason must depend on another effect.

original: de yang tha dad pa na yang /
analyzed: de yang tha dad pa na yang /
translated: And if that is different,

original: tha mi dad par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan 'bras bu gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro dgos pa sa thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan 'bras bu gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro dgos pa sa thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then there would be an infinite regress, because the reason for positing nondifference must follow another effect.

original: gzhan yang re zhig rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa gcig tu rtogs par bya ba yin zhing /🔽de las 'bras bu gcig yod pa de dang ldan pa'i phyir mthong ba rnams tha mi dad par nges par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang re zhig rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa gcig tu rtogs par bya ba yin zhing / de las 'bras bu gcig yod pa de dang ldan pa'i phyir mthong ba rnams tha mi dad par nges par bya ba yin la /
translated: Moreover, the cognition of conceptual thought is understood to be one.🔽And because it has one effect, the seen is ascertained to be nondifferent.

original: de las ni mthong ba'i 'bras bu gcig dang ldan pa'i gsal ba gcig tu bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de las ni mthong ba'i 'bras bu gcig dang ldan pa'i gsal ba gcig tu bya ba yin no //
translated: And from that, the manifestation is made into one that has one effect, the seen.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis gcig pa nyid la rnam par rtog pa de nyid kyis ni reg par mi nus so //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis gcig pa nyid la rnam par rtog pa de nyid kyis ni reg par mi nus so //
translated: The thought that conceives of the self as one is unable to touch the self, because the self is not an object of that thought.

original: gang gi phyir gang zhig nges par byas pa de la rnam par rtog pas gzung bar nus pa yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang zhig nges par byas pa de la rnam par rtog pas gzung bar nus pa yin na /
translated: For, if the self were an object of that thought, it would be possible to apprehend the self by means of that thought.

original: bdag nyid ni des nges par byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid ni des nges par byas pa ma yin no //
translated: But the self is not ascertained by that thought.

original: rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyis kyang mthong bas bskyed pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams bzung bar tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyis kyang mthong bas bskyed pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams bzung bar tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: And the self is not apprehended by another thought, because the thoughts that arise from seeing do not differ.

original: gang gi phyir mthong ba'i de ma thag tu byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa skyes pa nyid na mthong ba'i yul gsal ba dang mthong ba rnams tha mi dad par rtogs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthong ba'i de ma thag tu byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa skyes pa nyid na mthong ba'i yul gsal ba dang mthong ba rnams tha mi dad par rtogs te /
translated: For, when the thought that arises immediately after seeing arises, the object of seeing is clear, and the seeing is not different from the thought.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams tha mi dad par bzung yang rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya de lta na yang gsal ba rnams gcig tu zhen pa ni mthong ba rnams tha dad par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba🔽can ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams tha mi dad par bzung yang rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya de lta na yang gsal ba rnams gcig tu zhen pa ni mthong ba rnams tha dad par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin gyi /
translated: Even so, the conception of the manifestations as one is not preceded by the conception of the seen as different.

original: 'on kyang mthong ba'i yul dang mthong ba rnams ni mthong ba'i stobs kyis byung ba'i nges pas dus gcig kho nar tha mi dad par rtogs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang mthong ba'i yul dang mthong ba rnams ni mthong ba'i stobs kyis byung ba'i nges pas dus gcig kho nar tha mi dad par rtogs te /
translated: However, the seen object and the seeing are ascertained by the power of seeing to be not different at the same time.

original: des na zhen pa gcig byed pa nyid kyis mthong ba tha dad med par 'dzin la mthong ba gcig byed pa nyid kyang gsal ba rnams gcig tu zhen pa yin zhes @243b ci'i phyir brjod /
analyzed: des na zhen pa gcig byed pa nyid kyis mthong ba tha dad med par 'dzin la mthong ba gcig byed pa nyid kyang gsal ba rnams gcig tu zhen pa yin zhes @243b ci'i phyir brjod /
translated: Therefore, because of the single conception, the seen is apprehended as not different, and the single conception of the seen is the conception of the manifestations as one. Why would you say this?

original: gzhan yang ji ltar bum pa chu 'dzin par nus pa bzhin du gsal ba rnams mthong bar byed pa'am mthong bar zhen par byed par rtogs pa ni 'ga' yang med na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar bum pa chu 'dzin par nus pa bzhin du gsal ba rnams mthong bar byed pa'am mthong bar zhen par byed par rtogs pa ni 'ga' yang med na /
translated: Moreover, if no one understands that the manifestations see or that the manifestations are conceived to see in the same way that a pot is able to hold water,

original: de ji ltar gsal ba rnams mthong bar byed pa dang / mthong ba rnams kyang rnam par rtog par byed pa nyid kyis gcig nyid du rtogs so zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar gsal ba rnams mthong bar byed pa dang / mthong ba rnams kyang rnam par rtog par byed pa nyid kyis gcig nyid du rtogs so zhes brjod ce na /
translated: But how do you explain that they are understood to be one, since they are seen to be distinct and since they are conceptualized as distinct?

original: bshad pa 'di'i lan nyon cig don mthong ba'i nus pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rnam par rtog pa rnams ni 'bras bu tha mi dad pas tha dad pa med par mi brjod kyi /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di'i lan nyon cig don mthong ba'i nus pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rnam par rtog pa rnams ni 'bras bu tha mi dad pas tha dad pa med par mi brjod kyi /
translated: Listen to the answer to this question: since the effects of the conceptual thoughts that are the reason for the capacity to see the object are not different, they are not said to be different.

original: 'on kyang yul tha mi dad pas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang yul tha mi dad pas so //
translated: But they are not different because of the object.

original: 'di ltar shing mthong ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gcig gis don ci 'dra ba sgro btags pa de 'dra bar gzhan gyis kyang yin pa'i phyir shing mthong bas byas pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams don mtshungs par zhen par byed pa yin no zhes pa🔽de rnams la /
analyzed: 'di ltar shing mthong ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gcig gis don ci 'dra ba sgro btags pa de 'dra bar gzhan gyis kyang yin pa'i phyir shing mthong bas byas pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams don mtshungs par zhen par byed pa yin no zhes pa de rnams la /
translated: In this way, since one conceptual thought that arises from seeing a tree superimposes an object in such a way that another conceptual thought that arises from seeing a tree superimposes the object in exactly the same way, conceptual thoughts produced by seeing a tree apprehend the object as similar.

original: bdag gis ni shes pa 'di dang mtshungs par don yongs su bcad do snyam du 'dzin pa'i bya ba ni med mod kyi /
analyzed: bdag gis ni shes pa 'di dang mtshungs par don yongs su bcad do snyam du 'dzin pa'i bya ba ni med mod kyi /
translated: In response to this, we say that there is no action of apprehending that thinks, I ascertain the object in accordance with this consciousness.

original: 'on kyang de rnams kyis nye bar ston pa'i don la tha dad du zhen pa med pa'i phyir de rnams kyi yul tha mi dad par brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang de rnams kyis nye bar ston pa'i don la tha dad du zhen pa med pa'i phyir de rnams kyi yul tha mi dad par brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: But because there is no attachment to a different object that is indicated by those words, it is said that their objects are not different.

original: de la zhen pa'i don tha mi dad pa nyid yin la tha mi dad par zhen par bya ba de yang de nyid kyis zhen par byas pa de'i phyir rtog pa gzhan gyis de dag gcig tu nges par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la zhen pa'i don tha mi dad pa nyid yin la tha mi dad par zhen par bya ba de yang de nyid kyis zhen par byas pa de'i phyir rtog pa gzhan gyis de dag gcig tu nges par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The object of attachment is not different, and that which is to be attached to as undifferentiated is just that, so it is not ascertained as one by another conception.

original: gang gi phyir de dag nyid kyis zhen par byas pa de'i phyir sngon mthong ba gang yin pa de ni 'di yin no zhes zhen pa gcig gi rnam pa rjes su byed pa'i ngo shes pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag nyid kyis zhen par byas pa de'i phyir sngon mthong ba gang yin pa de ni 'di yin no zhes zhen pa gcig gi rnam pa rjes su byed pa'i ngo shes pa skye ba yin no //
translated: Because it is just that which is attached to, the recognition arises that has the form of a single attachment, “That which was seen before is this.”

original: tha mi dad par brtags don de yang mthong ba de'i rang bzhin du sgro btags pa yin la /
analyzed: tha mi dad par brtags don de yang mthong ba de'i rang bzhin du sgro btags pa yin la /
translated: That object which is imagined to be undifferentiated is superimposed as the nature of that seeing.

original: mthong ba'i don yang lta ba'i yul nyid do //
analyzed: mthong ba'i don yang lta ba'i yul nyid do //
translated: And the object of seeing is the object of the view.

original: des na sgro btags pa'i bdag nyid kyis mthong ba dang lta ba tha dad med par 'dzin to //
analyzed: des na sgro btags pa'i bdag nyid kyis mthong ba dang lta ba tha dad med par 'dzin to //
translated: Therefore, the self that is superimposed is apprehended as not different from seeing and the seer.

original: gal te de ltar na sgro btags kyi don gyis gsal ba rnams bsres pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na sgro btags kyi don gyis gsal ba rnams bsres pa yin te /
translated: If that is so, then the manifestation that is the referent of the superimposition is mixed together,

original: mthong ba gcig byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba gcig byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: because it is not the cause of a single seeing.

original: mthong ba gcig byed pa'i phyir ma yin no zhes ci ste brjod /
analyzed: mthong ba gcig byed pa'i phyir ma yin no zhes ci ste brjod /
translated: Why do you say that it is not the cause of a single seeing?

original: 'di ltar mthong ba'i yul nyid kyis na gsal ba de dag la mtshungs par rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba'i yul nyid kyis na gsal ba de dag la mtshungs par rtogs pa yin la /
translated: Because the manifestation is understood to be the same in regard to the object of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i yul yang mthong ba byed pa nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i yul yang mthong ba byed pa nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: The object of seeing is the cause of seeing, not anything else.

original: mthong ba tha mi dad bar bzung ba yang sgro btags kyi rang bzhin tha mi dad pa 'ba' zhig gis @244a * //
analyzed: mthong ba tha mi dad bar bzung ba yang sgro btags kyi rang bzhin tha mi dad pa 'ba' zhig gis @244a * //
translated: The apprehension of the nondifference of seeing is due solely to the nondifference of the nature of the superimposition.

original: yin gyi 'bras bu gzhan yang 'brel pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yin gyi 'bras bu gzhan yang 'brel pas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not due to the connection of another effect.

original: de'i phyir 'di tha mi dad pa 'dzin pa'i rim pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di tha mi dad pa 'dzin pa'i rim pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no way to apprehend the nondifference of this.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis sgro btags kyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa nyid yin pa de nyid mthong ba gcig tu 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis sgro btags kyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa nyid yin pa de nyid mthong ba gcig tu 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The nature of the superimposition of conceptualization is the apprehension of identity.

original: des na rim gyis tha mi dad par 'dzin pa dang rnam par rtog pa de nyid dam gzhan gyis rnam par rtog pa rnams gcig tu gzung bar bya ba ma yin no zhes gang brjod pa de gnyis ka yang bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rim gyis tha mi dad par 'dzin pa dang rnam par rtog pa de nyid dam gzhan gyis rnam par rtog pa rnams gcig tu gzung bar bya ba ma yin no zhes gang brjod pa de gnyis ka yang bsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, both of the following are refuted: the gradual apprehension of nondifference and the apprehension of conceptualizations as the same by the same or another.

original: 'bras bu 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa na rnam par rtog pas de byed pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rnams la gcig tu 'dzin to zhes ni kho bo cag mi smra'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa na rnam par rtog pas de byed pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rnams la gcig tu 'dzin to zhes ni kho bo cag mi smra'o //
translated: We do not say that when a result is realized as a result, conceptualization apprehends its own characteristics as the same.

original: 'on kyang nyams su myong ba'i 'bras bu dang 'brel par mthong ba na tha mi dad par zhen pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang nyams su myong ba'i 'bras bu dang 'brel par mthong ba na tha mi dad par zhen pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: However, when one sees that it is connected to the experienced result, one merely adheres to it as nondifferent.

original: ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i sgro btags pa'i bdag nyid kyis mthong ba dang mthong ba'i yul la rnam par rtog par byed pa na tha dad pa med par rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i sgro btags pa'i bdag nyid kyis mthong ba dang mthong ba'i yul la rnam par rtog par byed pa na tha dad pa med par rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bshad zin to //
translated: As was explained earlier, the object of seeing and the seeing are realized to be undifferentiated in the sense that they are the same in being the nature of the superimposition of conceptualization.

original: de lta yin na yang don gcig tu zhen pa'i 'bras bu gcig pa mthong ba gcig yin la /
analyzed: de lta yin na yang don gcig tu zhen pa'i 'bras bu gcig pa mthong ba gcig yin la /
translated: Even though this is the case, the effect of apprehending them as the same is the perception of a single object.

original: 'bras bu mthong ba tha mi dad pas kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi tshogs rnams gcig tu nges par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu mthong ba tha mi dad pas kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi tshogs rnams gcig tu nges par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: And because the effect of seeing is not differentiated, the collection of particular characteristics is ascertained as one.

original: gal te nges pa gcig tu rtogs pa'i 'bras bu ni mthong ba gcig tu bzung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te nges pa gcig tu rtogs pa'i 'bras bu ni mthong ba gcig tu bzung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: If the effect of the ascertainment of oneness is not the apprehension of a single seeing,

original: 'on kyang gcig tu sgro btags pa'i bdag nyid las ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gcig tu sgro btags pa'i bdag nyid las ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: then is it not the case that it is the nature of the superimposition of oneness?

original: bden te / tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin du sgro btags pa de nyid ni mtshungs par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: bden te / tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin du sgro btags pa de nyid ni mtshungs par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis 'jug pa yin te /
translated: That is true, but the superimposition of undifferentiated nature is the engagement of conceptualizations that appear as the same.

original: gzhan du na rnam par rtog pa thams cad tha mi dad par sgro 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na rnam par rtog pa thams cad tha mi dad par sgro 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, all conceptual thoughts would be indiscriminately reified.

original: mtshungs pa'i rnam pa yang mthong ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i rnam pa yang mthong ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin te /
translated: The similarity of aspects is also based on the appearance of the object,

original: de'i phyir mtshungs par rtogs pa'i 'bras bu can nyid kyis mthong ba rnams tha mi dad par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshungs par rtogs pa'i 'bras bu can nyid kyis mthong ba rnams tha mi dad par nges pa yin no //
translated: and therefore, the similarity of the effect of cognition ascertains that the appearances are not different.

original: gang gi tshe sgro btags kyi bdag nyid kho nas mthong ba dang snang ba thams cad tha mi dad pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sgro btags kyi bdag nyid kho nas mthong ba dang snang ba thams cad tha mi dad pa yin la /
translated: When all appearances and cognitions are not different in the sense of being superimposed,

original: sgro btags kyi rang bzhin tha mi dad par nges pa yang mtshungs par snang ba'i dbang gis yin pa de'i phyir 'bras bu rang bzhin gcig tu sgro 'dogs pa'i shes pa nyid kyis gsal ba rnam pa dang mthong ba rnams mtshungs par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sgro btags kyi rang bzhin tha mi dad par nges pa yang mtshungs par snang ba'i dbang gis yin pa de'i phyir 'bras bu rang bzhin gcig tu sgro 'dogs pa'i shes pa nyid kyis gsal ba rnam pa dang mthong ba rnams mtshungs par brjod pa yin no //
translated: and the nondifference of the superimposed nature is ascertained on the basis of the appearance of similarity, then the cognition that reifies the effect as having a single nature expresses the similarity of aspects and appearances.

original: rnam pa mtshungs pa'i shes @244b pa lnga ni ngo bo nyid kho nas gsal ba rnams kyi nu pa khyad par med do //
analyzed: rnam pa mtshungs pa'i shes @244b pa lnga ni ngo bo nyid kho nas gsal ba rnams kyi nu pa khyad par med do //
translated: The five cognitions that have similar aspects are not different in nature, because they are clear.

original: de nyid kyi phyir spyi med kyang gsal ba gcig mthong ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i don la brda byas pa nas de 'dra ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu thams cad la byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir spyi med kyang gsal ba gcig mthong ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i don la brda byas pa nas de 'dra ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu thams cad la byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even though there is no universal, when a concept arises from seeing one particular, the object that appears in the concept is designated as the universal, and the designation is extended to all causes of that kind of concept.

original: tshul 'dis chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu tha mi dad pa rnams la yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul 'dis chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu tha mi dad pa rnams la yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: By this method, one should understand the results that are not different, such as the apprehension of water.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa gzhan las ldog par sgro 'dogs pa na phyi rol gyis gzhan las bzlog par rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe dngos po gzhan med par bkag pa nyid kyis dngos po la reg pas dngos po rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir sgra dang🔽rnam par rtog pa med pa dgag pa la phyogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa gzhan las ldog par sgro 'dogs pa na phyi rol gyis gzhan las bzlog par rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe dngos po gzhan med par bkag pa nyid kyis dngos po la reg pas dngos po rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir sgra dang rnam par rtog pa med pa dgag pa la phyogs pa yin gyi /
translated: When one superimposes the exclusion of other on a concept, one understands the exclusion of other in external things. At that time, since one touches the thing by the negation of the nonexistence of other things, one understands the thing. Therefore, the word🔽and the concept are directed toward negation, not toward an affirmation of the thing.

original: ma yin par dgag pa la 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa la 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are directed toward an external negation, not toward an internal negation.

original: de'i phyir med pa dgag pa sgro 'dogs par rtogs pa na tha mi dad par zhen pas phyi rol gyi med par dgag pa nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa dgag pa sgro 'dogs par rtogs pa na tha mi dad par zhen pas phyi rol gyi med par dgag pa nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when one understands the superimposition of non-existence, one ascertains external non-existence by the adherence to non-difference.

original: des na phyi rol gyi cig shos kyis stong pa ni rnam par rtog pas nges par byas pa yin la /
analyzed: des na phyi rol gyi cig shos kyis stong pa ni rnam par rtog pas nges par byas pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the emptiness of the other external is ascertained by conceptualization.

original: sgro btags pa'i cig shos kyis stong pa ni gzung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i cig shos kyis stong pa ni gzung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The emptiness of the other superimposed is to be apprehended.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na slob dpon chos kyi grags pa yang med par dgag pa nyid bzhed par gdon mi za'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na slob dpon chos kyi grags pa yang med par dgag pa nyid bzhed par gdon mi za'o //
translated: For this very reason, it is certain that the Acarya Dharmakirti also accepts only non-existence.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa ma rig pa'i bdag nyid yin pas med pa'i don ston pa yin na ci 'dra ston par 'gyur ba zhig na nges par ston pa ni nyams su myong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa ma rig pa'i bdag nyid yin pas med pa'i don ston pa yin na ci 'dra ston par 'gyur ba zhig na nges par ston pa ni nyams su myong ngo zhe na /
translated: If conceptualization, which is of the nature of nescience, teaches the meaning of non-existence, what is it that it teaches? It is definitely experienced as teaching.

original: smras pa / nyams su myong ba'i bag chags las ni nges par 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / nyams su myong ba'i bag chags las ni nges par 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: We reply: The ascertainment is from the latent impressions of experience.

original: ma rig pa'i bag chags las ni med par 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i bag chags las ni med par 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
translated: But the apprehension of non-existence is from the latent impressions of nescience.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa thams cad la rgyu mtshan bag chags gnyis yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa thams cad la rgyu mtshan bag chags gnyis yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If the two latent impressions of the reason do not exist for all conceptual thoughts,

original: gang gi phyir med pa dbang phyug la sogs pa dang / rtag pa'i dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir med pa dbang phyug la sogs pa dang / rtag pa'i dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: then why do conceptual thoughts arise regarding non-existent things such as Īśvara, permanent entities, and non-entities?

original: bden te / de dag skye ba kho na ste bag chags gnyis dang ni 'brel par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bden te / de dag skye ba kho na ste bag chags gnyis dang ni 'brel par blta bar bya'o //
translated: It is true that they do arise, but it should be seen that they are connected to the two latent impressions.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa yod pa bum pa la sogs pa dang / med pa dbang phyug la sogs pa'i chos can dang yod pa sngon po nyid la sogs pa dang / med pa rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos nye bar rtogs par byed pa yin no //🔽de la yod pa'i chos dang chos can gyi rnam par rtog pa ni de ma yin pa las @245a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa yod pa bum pa la sogs pa dang / med pa dbang phyug la sogs pa'i chos can dang yod pa sngon po nyid la sogs pa dang / med pa rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos nye bar rtogs par byed pa yin no // de la yod pa'i chos dang chos can gyi rnam par rtog pa ni de ma yin pa las @245a * //
translated: Thus, conceptual thoughts apprehend existent things such as pots and non-existent things such as Īśvara as subjects, and they apprehend existent attributes such as blueness and non-existent attributes such as permanence.

original: bzlog pa'i rang bzhin gyis dngos po mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can kho na ste /
analyzed: bzlog pa'i rang bzhin gyis dngos po mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can kho na ste /
translated: Among them, conceptual thoughts of existent things and subjects are preceded by seeing things that have the nature of being the opposite of what is not that.

original: 'di ltar chu nyid la 'di ni chu'o snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni chu mthong ba la brten pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar chu nyid la 'di ni chu'o snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni chu mthong ba la brten pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, the conceptual thought that thinks “this is water” is based on seeing water.

original: gang zhig smig rgyu la 'di ni chu'o zhes nges par rtogs pa de chu dang smig rgyu'i rang bzhin mthong ba las gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig smig rgyu la 'di ni chu'o zhes nges par rtogs pa de chu dang smig rgyu'i rang bzhin mthong ba las gyur pa yin no //
translated: And the conceptual thought that ascertains “this is water” with respect to a mirage is based on seeing the nature of water and a mirage.

original: yang gang zhig chus dben pa'i phyogs su chu'o zhes sgro 'dogs pa gnyis ka dang 'dres pa'i rnam par rtog pa de yang rang bzhin gnyis mthong ba la rag las pa kho na'o //
analyzed: yang gang zhig chus dben pa'i phyogs su chu'o zhes sgro 'dogs pa gnyis ka dang 'dres pa'i rnam par rtog pa de yang rang bzhin gnyis mthong ba la rag las pa kho na'o //
translated: Moreover, the conceptual thought that superimposes “water” on a place devoid of water is also based on seeing both natures.

original: de'i phyir de ltar dngos por gyur pa'i chos can gyi rnam par rtog pa ni gsum yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dngos por gyur pa'i chos can gyi rnam par rtog pa ni gsum yin no //
translated: Thus, the conceptual thought that has a real property-possessor as its object is of three types.

original: chos gzhan dang yul gzhan dang 'brel pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni chos can kho na'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: chos gzhan dang yul gzhan dang 'brel pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni chos can kho na'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
translated: The conceptual thought that is related to another property and another object is a conceptual thought that has only a property-possessor as its object.

original: 'di sngon po'o zhe 'am 'di ni sngon po zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di sngon po'o zhe 'am 'di ni sngon po zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “this is blue” or “this is a blue color.”

original: chos tsam gyis ni 'di ni sngon po'o zhe'am yang na 'di ni sngon po ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos tsam gyis ni 'di ni sngon po'o zhe'am yang na 'di ni sngon po ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: By the mere fact of its being a phenomenon, it is said this is blue or this is not blue.

original: de'i phyir chos kyi rnam par rtog pa ni gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos kyi rnam par rtog pa ni gcig kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the conceptualization of a phenomenon is only one.

original: gang yang yod pa ma yin pa'i chos can dbang phyug la dmigs pa'i snang ba de yang de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa la sogs pa'i dngos po mthong ba las skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yang yod pa ma yin pa'i chos can dbang phyug la dmigs pa'i snang ba de yang de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa la sogs pa'i dngos po mthong ba las skyes pa yin te /
translated: The appearance of the non-existent phenomenon, the Lord, is also produced from seeing things that are not his nature, etc.

original: gang gi phyir dbang phyug nges par bsams pa 'di ni mthong ba'i sngon po la sogs pa las ldog par brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang phyug nges par bsams pa 'di ni mthong ba'i sngon po la sogs pa las ldog par brtags pa yin te /
translated: Because this definite conception of the Lord is imagined to be a negation of the seen blue, etc.

original: gzhan du na dbang phyug nyid du brtags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na dbang phyug nyid du brtags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be imagined as the Lord.

original: dbang phyug ldog par brtags pa na yang ldog pa'i rang bzhin gzhan dang 'dra bar brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang phyug ldog par brtags pa na yang ldog pa'i rang bzhin gzhan dang 'dra bar brtags pa yin te /
translated: And when the Lord is imagined as a negation, the negation is imagined to be similar to another thing that has a nature of negation.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'di yang ldog pa'i dngos po mthong ba la rag las pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'di yang ldog pa'i dngos po mthong ba la rag las pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this conceptualization is also dependent on seeing a negated thing.

original: de ltar ni tha na dngos po tsam du dbang phyug dngos po gzhan dang 'dra bar brtags pa'i phyir na ldog pa'i dngos po mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar ni tha na dngos po tsam du dbang phyug dngos po gzhan dang 'dra bar brtags pa'i phyir na ldog pa'i dngos po mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can nyid do //
translated: In this way, even in the case of mere entity, since the Lord is imagined to be like another entity, the seeing of the entity of cessation precedes.

original: snang ba 'ga' zhig la rtag pa nyid du brtags pa na ldog pa'i dngos po mthong ba nyid kyis rnam par rtog pas bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: snang ba 'ga' zhig la rtag pa nyid du brtags pa na ldog pa'i dngos po mthong ba nyid kyis rnam par rtog pas bzung ba yin no //
translated: When something is imagined to be permanent in some appearance, it is apprehended by conceptualization through the very seeing of the entity of cessation.

original: de lta bu nyams su myong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu nyams su myong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn’t that experienced?

original: bden mod kyi /
analyzed: bden mod kyi /
translated: It is true.

original: 'on kyang rtag pa nyid snang ba las gzhan yin par brtags pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang rtag pa nyid snang ba las gzhan yin par brtags pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: However, it is not imagined that permanence is different from appearance.

original: 'on kyang mthong ba nyid du yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mthong ba nyid du yin no //
translated: Rather, it is just seeing.

original: des na de la yang dngos po mthong ba'i bya ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de la yang dngos po mthong ba'i bya ba yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in that case, the activity of seeing the entity exists.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bum pa med par rtags @245b pa yang sngon du 'gro ba can nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bum pa med par rtags @245b pa yang sngon du 'gro ba can nyid do //
translated: For that very reason, the nonexistence of the pot also precedes.

original: 'di ltar gal te ldog pa tsam 'ba' zhig tu rtogs na ni bum pa mi rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te ldog pa tsam 'ba' zhig tu rtogs na ni bum pa mi rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, if mere cessation is understood, the pot is not understood.

original: 'brel pa ma brtags pa'i phyir ro //🔽de'i phyir bum pa nyid gnyis ka'i rang bzhin du nges pa ni yod pa'am /
analyzed: 'brel pa ma brtags pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir bum pa nyid gnyis ka'i rang bzhin du nges pa ni yod pa'am /
translated: because the relation is not examined.

original: med par rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir bum pa med pa ni dngos po'i chos yin no //
analyzed: med par rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir bum pa med pa ni dngos po'i chos yin no //
translated: Therefore, the ascertainment of the nature of both the pot and nonexistence is either the apprehension of existence or the apprehension of nonexistence.🔽Therefore, the nonexistence of the pot is a quality of an entity.

original: gang gi tshe dngos po cung zad kyang med do zhes rtogs pa de lta na yang dngos po tsam mthong ba'i bya ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po cung zad kyang med do zhes rtogs pa de lta na yang dngos po tsam mthong ba'i bya ba yod pa yin no //
translated: Even when one understands that not even the slightest entity exists, the activity of seeing mere entity exists.

original: gal te bum pa'i rnam par rtog pa bum pa mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin gyi med pa'i rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bum pa'i rnam par rtog pa bum pa mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin gyi med pa'i rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If the conception of the pot is preceded by the seeing of the pot, it is not the apprehension of nonexistence.

original: gal te de lta yin na yang de lta na yang yod pa las log par nges pa gang yin pa de nyid bum pa dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir log pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na yang de lta na yang yod pa las log par nges pa gang yin pa de nyid bum pa dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir log pa yin te /
translated: Even if that is so, the ascertainment of the opposite of existence is itself the opposite because it is not similar to the pot.

original: de'i phyir bum pa mthong ba'i bya ba yang yod do zhes brjod la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bum pa mthong ba'i bya ba yang yod do zhes brjod la /
translated: Therefore, the activity of seeing the pot exists.

original: bum pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa la bum pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan gyis yang byed pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: bum pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa la bum pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan gyis yang byed pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: In the conceptual thought of the nonexistence of a pot, the intrinsic identity of the emptiness of the intrinsic reality of a pot is produced by another.

original: gal te bum pa 'ga' zhig ces mthong na ni bum ba med na rtag mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te bum pa 'ga' zhig ces mthong na ni bum ba med na rtag mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one sees that a pot is something, then since it is not possible for a pot to be nonexistent, the conceptual thought of the nonexistence of a pot is not tenable.

original: bum pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa la ni bum pa nyams su myong ba'i byed pa po yod la rag na /
analyzed: bum pa med pa'i rnam par rtog pa la ni bum pa nyams su myong ba'i byed pa po yod la rag na /
translated: In the conceptual thought of the nonexistence of a pot, there is the activity of the experience of a pot.

original: ci dbang phyug med do snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de la yang dbang phyug mthong ba'i byed pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci dbang phyug med do snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de la yang dbang phyug mthong ba'i byed pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: But in the conceptual thought that thinks “Īśvara does not exist,” is there the activity of seeing Īśvara?

original: med do zhes smra'o //
analyzed: med do zhes smra'o //
translated: We say that there is not.

original: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it?

original: ji ltar dbang phyug rtog pa 'dra ba'i dngos po mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa de bzhin du med pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang dbang phyug gi chos kyi rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir 'dra ba'i dngos po mthong ba'i sngon du 'gro ba🔽can yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar dbang phyug rtog pa 'dra ba'i dngos po mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa de bzhin du med pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang dbang phyug gi chos kyi rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir 'dra ba'i dngos po mthong ba'i sngon du 'gro ba can yin no //
translated: Just as the seeing of a thing that resembles the object of the idea of Īśvara precedes the idea of Īśvara, so too the idea of nonexistence is preceded by the seeing of a thing that resembles the object of the idea of Īśvara’s attributes.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa bzhi char gyi snang ba yang 'dra ba'i dngos po mthong ba las yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa bzhi char gyi snang ba yang 'dra ba'i dngos po mthong ba las yin la /
translated: Therefore, the appearance of all four ideas is due to the seeing of a thing that resembles the object of the idea of Īśvara.

original: log par 'dzin pa'i shes pa las ni rang gi rnam pa dang mthun pa sgro 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: log par 'dzin pa'i shes pa las ni rang gi rnam pa dang mthun pa sgro 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: But the cognition that apprehends the nonexistent superimposes a form that is similar to its own aspect.

original: des na rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa'i don 'di ni gtan med pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa'i don 'di ni gtan med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object that is imagined by the idea is utterly nonexistent.

original: de gzhan las log par rtog pa na yang 'dra ba'i phyir phyi rol na yang gzhan las ldog par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gzhan las log par rtog pa na yang 'dra ba'i phyir phyi rol na yang gzhan las ldog par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one conceives of it as different from others, because it resembles the object of the idea of Īśvara, one also conceives of it as different from external things.

original: de'i phyir cig shos kyi rang bzhin dang ma 'dres pa'i sgo nas phyi rol yang rnam par rtog pa'i byed pas khyab par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir cig shos kyi rang bzhin dang ma 'dres pa'i sgo nas phyi rol yang rnam par rtog pa'i byed pas khyab par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, the external is also pervaded by the activity of conceptualization, in terms of not being mixed with the nature of the other.

original: dngos po'i cha la yang reg pa ni ma yin no //🔽de'i phyir phyi rol yang dngos po @246a * //
analyzed: dngos po'i cha la yang reg pa ni ma yin no // de'i phyir phyi rol yang dngos po @246a * //
translated: But it is not the case that it touches the aspect of the thing.

original: med pa nyid rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: med pa nyid rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin no //
translated: Therefore, the external is also a non-thing, the object of conceptualization.

original: des na gang gzung ba dang gang yang zhen par byas pa de gnyis ka yang gzhan las ldog pa yin gyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gang gzung ba dang gang yang zhen par byas pa de gnyis ka yang gzhan las ldog pa yin gyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, both the apprehended and the apprehender are only the negation of other, not things.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir // ldog pa ngo bo nyid med phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir // ldog pa ngo bo nyid med phyir //
translated: Because the negation has no intrinsic reality,

original: gnas dang gnas min rtog pa'ang med //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas min rtog pa'ang med //
translated: There is no conception of the possible and the impossible.

original: spyi yi blo yang bslad pa yin //
analyzed: spyi yi blo yang bslad pa yin //
translated: The cognition of the universal is also erroneous.

original: des na sun dbyung ba yang med //🔽ces bshad do //
analyzed: des na sun dbyung ba yang med // ces bshad do //
translated: Therefore, there is no refutation.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i don gang yin pa de nyid sgra'i don yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i don gang yin pa de nyid sgra'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning of conceptualization is the meaning of the word.

original: des na sgra'i don ni don dam par med pa nyid de /
analyzed: des na sgra'i don ni don dam par med pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the word does not ultimately exist.

original: sgra don 'di dang gzhi mthun nyid //
analyzed: sgra don 'di dang gzhi mthun nyid //
translated: The common locus of this meaning and the word

original: yod pa min yang ji lta bur //
analyzed: yod pa min yang ji lta bur //
translated: Although it does not exist,

original: grags pa bzhin du brjod bya ste //
analyzed: grags pa bzhin du brjod bya ste //
translated: it is expressed as if it were known,

original: dngos la 'di ni mi srid do //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos la 'di ni mi srid do // zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: but this is impossible in reality.

original: sgro btags de rtogs pa na de dang 'dra ba'i phyi rol rtogs par 'gyur ba des na phyi rol yang sgra'i don du btags pa yin te /
analyzed: sgro btags de rtogs pa na de dang 'dra ba'i phyi rol rtogs par 'gyur ba des na phyi rol yang sgra'i don du btags pa yin te /
translated: When one understands that superimposition, one understands the external object that is similar to it. Therefore, the external object is also designated as the meaning of a word.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de yi ngo bor sgro btags pa //
analyzed: de yi ngo bor sgro btags pa //
translated: The superimposition of its nature

original: rtogs pas gzhan bzlog rtogs pa'i phyir //🔽sgra don gang yin de nyid ces //
analyzed: rtogs pas gzhan bzlog rtogs pa'i phyir // sgra don gang yin de nyid ces //
translated: is understood by excluding other things.🔽There is no contradiction in saying

original: brjod pa la ni 'gal ba med //🔽ces bshad do //
analyzed: brjod pa la ni 'gal ba med // ces bshad do //
translated: that the meaning of a word is just that.

original: sgra sbyor ba'i dus na ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi gzhan sel ba'i bdag nyid kyang nges pa'i rang bzhin gyis brjod bya nyid du sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: sgra sbyor ba'i dus na ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi gzhan sel ba'i bdag nyid kyang nges pa'i rang bzhin gyis brjod bya nyid du sbyor ba yin te /
translated: When a word is applied, the exclusion of other things, which is the object of conceptual cognition, is also applied as the meaning by the nature of ascertainment.

original: de lta ma yin na gzhan sel ba gcig nyid brjod byar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzhan sel ba gcig nyid brjod byar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could the exclusion of other things be the meaning?

original: des na rnam par rtog pa'i yul ni gzhan sel ba yin la /
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa'i yul ni gzhan sel ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, the object of conceptual cognition is the exclusion of other things.

original: de yang gzhan dang bral ba brjod byar sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang gzhan dang bral ba brjod byar sbyor ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, the object of exclusion is applied as the expressed meaning.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bum pa dang snyim pa ci 'dra ba zhig gis bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bum pa dang snyim pa ci 'dra ba zhig gis bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: What kind of vase, what kind of ladle, etc. are to be used?

original: de'i phyir sel ba gnyis brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sel ba gnyis brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, exclusion is to be expressed in two ways:

original: nges pa'i rang bzhin dang rnam par rtog pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: nges pa'i rang bzhin dang rnam par rtog pa'i yul lo //
translated: the nature of determination and the object of conceptual thought.🔽As it is said:

original: ji skad du de las gzhan pa yongs spangs nas //
analyzed: ji skad du de las gzhan pa yongs spangs nas //
translated: Having completely excluded what is other than that,

original: 'jug 'gyur zhes kyang sgra brjod de //
analyzed: 'jug 'gyur zhes kyang sgra brjod de //
translated: the word is said to engage.

original: de yis de dag rnams las 'di //
analyzed: de yis de dag rnams las 'di //
translated: By that, from among those,

original: rnam mi gcod na de ji ltar //
analyzed: rnam mi gcod na de ji ltar //
translated: if this is not differentiated, how is it?

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained.

original: gang zhig dngos sam dngos las gzhan sel 'gar yang brjod par mi nus shing //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos sam dngos las gzhan sel 'gar yang brjod par mi nus shing //
translated: That which cannot be expressed anywhere, either as a positive or as an exclusion of other,

original: bstan bcos rig pa'i blo yis che ba'ang gang du nyams 'gyur brjod bya'i mtha' //
analyzed: bstan bcos rig pa'i blo yis che ba'ang gang du nyams 'gyur brjod bya'i mtha' //
translated: and where the greatness of the treatise is also diminished by the mind of knowledge,

original: sel ba rnam par phye bas chos mchog bdag gis dge ba gang thob pa //
analyzed: sel ba rnam par phye bas chos mchog bdag gis dge ba gang thob pa //
translated: whatever virtue I have obtained by differentiating exclusion,

original: des bdag 'gro 'di mun pa mtshams med rgyun ni gcod par byed gyur cig / slob dpon chos mchog gis mdzad pa gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: des bdag 'gro 'di mun pa mtshams med rgyun ni gcod par byed gyur cig / slob dpon chos mchog gis mdzad pa gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa rdzogs so /
translated: The treatise called “Exclusion of Other” composed by Master Dharmottara is complete.

original: // / @246b kha che'i pandi ta skal ldan rgyal po dang / lo ts'a ba dge slong blo ldan shes rab kyis kha che'i grong khyer dpe med du bsgyur ba'o /
analyzed: // / @246b kha che'i pandi ta skal ldan rgyal po dang / lo ts'a ba dge slong blo ldan shes rab kyis kha che'i grong khyer dpe med du bsgyur ba'o /
